entry.title: The 2-dimension series of the just-nonsolvable BSV group
entry.summary: I also submitted this paper as math.GR/0112109... it is therefore withdrawn from math.GR/0104076
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn, because also submitted as math.GR/0112109

entry.title: Finite simple groups of Lie type as expanders
entry.summary: Finite simple groups of Lie type as expanders

entry.title: Excursions in Group Theory
entry.summary: This is a book on Group.

entry.title: Dominions in the variety of metabelian groups
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn. The results are now part of math.GR/9804072.

entry.title: Complete reducibility and isogenies over an arbitrary field
entry.summary: In this paper, we investigate how the property of $G$-complete reducibility behaves under isogenies over an arbitrary field.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper was superseded by arXiv:1511.08520 [math.GR]

entry.title: The quadratic isoperimetric inequality for mapping tori of free group automorphisms II: The general case
entry.summary: If F is a finitely generated free group and \phi is an automorphism of F then the mapping torus of \phi admits a quadratic isoperimetric inequality. This is the third and final paper in a series proving this theorem. The first two were math.GR/0211459 and math.GR/0507589.

entry.title: (p,q,r)-Generations for Janko Groups $J_1$ and $J_2$
entry.summary: No abstract is available

entry.title: Discrete groups, Grothendieck rings and families of finite subgroups
entry.summary: In this paper we use families of finite subgroups to study Grothendieck rings associated to certain discrete groups, such as the arithmetic ones.

entry.title: Ping-Pong on Negatively Curved Groups
entry.summary: We prove several generalisations of the ping-pong lemma for negatively curved groups.

entry.title: Uniform Exponential Growth of Polycyclic Groups
entry.summary: We prove that polycyclic groups are of polynomial growth or of uniform exponential growth.

entry.title: Artin monoids inject in their groups
entry.summary: We prove that the natural homomorphism from an Artin monoid to its associated Artin group is always injective

entry.title: K(π, 1)'s for Artin groups of finite type
entry.summary: We construct K(\pi, 1)'s for Artin groups of type C_n and D_n.

entry.title: Growth rates of small cancellation groups
entry.summary: We estimate growth rates for small cancellation groups. In particular we show that there is a continuum possible values for exponential growth rates.

entry.title: Uniform Growth, Actions on Trees and $GL_2$
entry.summary: We use actions on trees to determine uniform exponential growth for subgroups of $GL_2$.

entry.title: Deflating infinite Coxeter groups to finite groups
entry.summary: This paper considers a smaller version of the 26-node presentation of the Bimonster group.

entry.title: Uniform Exponential Growth for Linear Groups
entry.summary: We announce the folowing result: Any finitely generated non virtually solvable linear group over a field of characteristic zero has uniform exponential growth.

entry.title: The dual horospherical Radon transform for polynomials
entry.summary: We show how to calculate the dual horospherical Radon transform of a polynomial in terms of the Harish-Chandra c-function.

entry.title: On the analytic zero divisor conjecture of Linnell
entry.summary: In this note we prove that in the case of finitely generated amenable groups the classical zero divisor conjecture implies the analytic zero divisor conjecture of Linnell.

entry.title: The Frattini subgroup for subgroups of hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We prove that for a finitely generated subgroup $H$ of a word-hyperbolic group $G$ the Frattini subgroup $F(H)$ of $H$ is finite.

entry.title: Boundaries of hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We survey the known results regarding the boundaries of word-hyperbolic groups.

entry.title: A remark on mapping tori of free group endomorphisms
entry.summary: We observe that the results of Feighn-Handel and Geoghegan-Mihalik-Sapir-Wise about coherence and Hopficity of mapping tori of injective endomorphisms of free groups extend to non-injective endomorphisms.

entry.title: What is the monster?
entry.summary: A content-free expository article about the monster simple group.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Notices of the A.M.S, vol 49, no. 9 Oct 2002, pages 1076-1077

entry.title: The Dehn Function of Richard Thompson's Group F is Quadratic
entry.summary: We prove that the Dehn function (that is, the smallest isoperimetric function) of the Richard Thompson's group F is quadratic.

entry.title: Quasi-hyperbolic planes in hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: The hyperbolic plane admits a quasi-isometric embedding into a hyperbolic group if and only if the group is not virtually free.

entry.title: A note on localizations of perfect groups
entry.summary: We describe a perfect group whose localization is not perfect.

entry.title: On linearity of finitely generated R-analytic groups
entry.summary: We prove that if $R$ is a commutative Noetherian local pro-$p$domain of characteristic 0 then every finitely generated$R$-standard group is $R$-linear.

entry.title: On the characters of pro-p groups of finite rank
entry.summary: We prove the rationality of some zeta functions associated tocharacters of pro-p groups of finite rank.

entry.title: Buildings and classical groups
entry.summary: This is a survey article on classical groups (over arbitrary division rings) and their geometries.

entry.title: On a small cancellation theorem of Gromov
entry.summary: We give a combinatorial proof of a theorem of Gromov, which extends the scope of small cancellation theory to group presentations arising from labelled graphs.

entry.title: The Fesenko groups have finite width
entry.summary: We prove that the Fesenko Groups, which occur as natural closed subgroups of the Nottingham Group, have finite width and infinite obliquity.

entry.title: Artin groups of spherical type up to isomorphism
entry.summary: We prove that two Artin groups of spherical type are isomorphic if and only if their defining Coxeter graphs are the same.

entry.title: On quasi-separative semigroups
entry.summary: We built some congruences on semigroups, from where a decomposition of quasi-separative semigroups was obtained.

entry.title: Every smooth p-adic Lie group admits a compatible analytic structure
entry.summary: We show that every finite-dimensional p-adic Lie group of class C^k admits a C^k-compatible analytic Lie group structure.

entry.title: The Even Isomorphism Theorem for Coxeter Groups
entry.summary: We prove the even isomorphism theorem for Coxeter groups

entry.title: The Algebra of Strand Splitting. I. A Braided Version of Thompson's Group V
entry.summary: We construct a braided version of Thompson's group V.

entry.title: Straight thin combings
entry.summary: We introduce a class of thin combings and prove that it has a nice behaviour in free constructions. Among corollaries, we deduce the relative metabolicity, in the sense of Gersten, of Sela's limit groups.

entry.title: Boundedly Simple Groups Have Trivial Bounded Cohomology
entry.summary: We observe that the singular part of the second bounded cohomology group of boundedly simple groups is trivial.

entry.title: Semisymmetric cubic graphs of twice odd order
entry.summary: The groups which can act semisymmetrically on a cubic graph of twice odd order are determined modulo a normal subgroup which acts semiregularly on the vertices of the graph.

entry.title: Transformation Digroups
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of a transformation digroup and prove that every digroup is isomorphic to a transformation digroup.

entry.title: Products of characters with few irreducible constituents
entry.summary: We study the solvable groups $G$ that have an irreducible character $\chi\in \Irr(G)$ such that $\chi \bar{\chi}$ has at most two non-principal irreducible constituents.

entry.title: Hyperbolic groups admit proper affine isometric actions on $l^p$-spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we show that hyperbolic groups admit proper affine isometric actions on $l^p$-spaces.

entry.title: Questions on surface braid groups
entry.summary: We provide new group presentations for surface braid groups which are positive. We study some properties of such presentations and we solve the conjugacy problem in a particular case.

entry.title: Growth of relatively hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We show that a relatively hyperbolic group either is virtually cyclic or has uniform exponential growth.

entry.title: Groups with quadratic-non-quadratic Dehn functions
entry.summary: We construct a finitely presented group $G$ with non-quadratic Dehn function $f$ majorizable by a quadratic function on arbitrary long intervals.

entry.title: A finitely presented group with two non-homeomorphic asymptotic cones
entry.summary: We give an example of a finitely presented group $G$ with two non-$\pi_1$-equivalent asymptotic cones.

entry.title: Thompson's Group F is Not Kahler
entry.summary: The purpose of this note is to prove that Richard Thompson's group F and variants of it studied by Ken Brown are not Kahler groups.

entry.title: An incoherent simple group
entry.summary: We give an example of a finitely presented simple group containing a finitely generated subgroup which is not finitely presented.

entry.title: Abelianization conjectures for some arithmetic square complex groups
entry.summary: We extend a conjecture of Kimberley-Robertson on the abelianizations of certain square complex groups.

entry.title: S-arithmetic groups of SL_2 type
entry.summary: For a number field K, we show that any S-arithmetic subgroup of SL_2(K) contains a subgroup of finite index generated by three elements if card(S)> 1.

entry.title: A product decomposition for the classical quasisimple groups
entry.summary: We prove that every quasisimple group of classical type is a product of boundedly many conjugates of a quasisimple subgroup of type A_n.

entry.title: The structure of the normalisers of the congruence subgroups of the Hecke group $G_5$
entry.summary: We determine the normalisers of congruence subgroups of $G_5$.

entry.title: The Asymptotic Dimension of the First Grigorchuk Group is Infinity
entry.summary: We prove that the asymptotic dimension of the first Grigorchuk group is infinity.

entry.title: Uniform Kazhdan groups
entry.summary: We construct first examples of infinite groups having property (T) whose Kazhdan constants admit a lower bound independent of the choice of a finite generating set.

entry.title: Local indicability and commutator subgroups of Artin groups
entry.summary: We determine which of the finite-type Artin groups are locally indicable, and compute presentations for their commutator subgroups.

entry.title: Groups of Intermediate Growth: an Introduction for Beginners
entry.summary: We present an accessible introduction to basic results on groups of intermediate growth.

entry.title: Combinatorial properties of virtual braids
entry.summary: We study combinatorial properties of virtual braid groups and we describe relations with finite type invariant theory for virtual knots and Yang-Baxter equations

entry.title: Metabelian Wreath Products Are LERF
entry.summary: We show that a wreath product of two finitely generated abelian groups is LERF. Consequently the free metabelian groups are LERF.

entry.title: Families of linear semigroups with intermediate growth
entry.summary: Methods from additive number theory are applied to construct families of finitely generated linear semigroups with intermediate growth.

entry.title: Strongly indecomposable finite groups
entry.summary: Motivated by examples in infinite group theory, we classify the finite groups whose subgroups can never be decomposed as direct products.

entry.title: Wreath product of groups with infinite conjugacy classes
entry.summary: We characterise the group property of being with infinite conjugacy classes for wreath products of groups

entry.title: Interpreting the arithmetic in Thompson's group F
entry.summary: We prove that the elementary theory of Thompson's group $F$ is hereditarily undecidable.

entry.title: Solutions a divers problemes de decision dans un groupe hyperbolique
entry.summary: We give solutions to several decision problems in word hyperbolic groups

entry.title: On accessibility of finitely generated groups
entry.summary: We prove an accessibility result for finitely generated groups that combines Sela's acylindrical accessibility with Linell accessibility.

entry.title: On the Group of Polynomial Functions in a Group
entry.summary: In this paper, we study connections between the structure of a group and the structure of the group (under pointwise product) of its polynomial functions.

entry.title: Some aspects of profinite group theory
entry.summary: A survey of recent results about profinite groups, and results about infinite and finite groups where the theory of profinite groups plays a leading role.

entry.title: On the polynomial automorphisms of a group
entry.summary: We prove that if a group is nilpotent (resp. metabelian), then so is the subgroup of its automorphism group generated by all polynomial automorphisms.

entry.title: A 2-generated 2-related group with no non-trivial finite factors
entry.summary: We construct a 2-generated 2-related group without non-trivial finite factors. That answers a question of J. Button.

entry.title: On Groups with a Supercomplemented Subgroup
entry.summary: Groups, in which every subgroup containing some fixed primary cyclic subgroup has a complement, are investigated.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Trans. In-te Math. NAS Ukraine 3 (2006), n4, 153-164

entry.title: On the inheriting of the property $C_π$ by some normal subgroups
entry.summary: In the paper we prove that the Hall property $C_\pi$ is inherited by normal subgroups which index is a $\pi'$-number.

entry.title: Ranks of the Sylow 2-subgroups of the classical groups
entry.summary: We determine the ranks and normal ranks of the Sylow 2-subgroups of the classical groups of odd characteristic.

entry.title: Ranks of the Sylow 2-subgroups of the classical Simple groups
entry.summary: We determine the ranks of the Sylow 2-subgroups of the classical simple groups of odd characteristic.

entry.title: Embeddings and chains of free groups
entry.summary: We build two non-abelian CSA-groups in which maximal abelian subgroups are conjugate and divisible.

entry.title: Detecting automorphic orbits in free groups
entry.summary: We present an effective algorithm for detecting automorphic orbits in free groups, as well as a number of algorithmic improvements of train tracks for free group automorphisms.

entry.title: Cayley automaton semigroups
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize when a Cayley automaton semigroup is a group, is trivial, is finite, is free, is a left zero semigroup, or is a right zero semigroup.

entry.title: The Conjugacy Problem in the Grigorchuk Group is polynomial time decidable
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that the Conjugacy Problem in the Grigorchuk group $\Gamma$ has polynomial time complexity.

entry.title: Splitting of Sharply 2-Transitive Groups of Characteristic 3
entry.summary: We give a group theoretic proof of the splitting of sharply 2-transitive groups of characteristic 3.

entry.title: Brauer pairs of Camina p-groups of nilpotence class 2
entry.summary: In this paper, we find a condition that characterizes when two Camina $p$-groups of nilpotence class 2 form a Brauer pair.

entry.title: Examples of buildings constructed via covering spaces
entry.summary: Covering space theory is used to construct new examples of buildings.

entry.title: A remark on double cosets
entry.summary: If a soluble group $G$ contains two finitely generated abelian subgroups $A,B$ such that the number of double cosets $AgB$ is finite, then $G$ is shown to be virtually polycyclic.

entry.title: On genericity and weight in the free group
entry.summary: I prove that the generic type of the free nonabelian group has infinite weight (strengthening non superstability of the free group).

entry.title: On identities in Thompson's group
entry.summary: In this article we prove that Thompson's group does not belong to any algebraic variety.

entry.title: A note on Renner monoids
entry.summary: We provide every Renner monoids with a monoid presentation, and we introduce a length function which extends the Coxeter length function.

entry.title: Topological Structure on Abel-Grassmann's Groupoids
entry.summary: In this paper we have discussed the ideals in Abel Grassmann's groupoids and construct their topologies.

entry.title: Combinatorial distance between braid words
entry.summary: We give a simple naming argument for establishing lower bounds on the combinatorial distance between (positive) braid words.

entry.title: Transfinite normal and composition series of groups
entry.summary: Normal and composition series of groups enumerated by ordinal numbers are studied. The Jordan-Holder theorem for them is proved.

entry.title: Finite symplectic matrix groups
entry.summary: This paper classifies the maximal finite subgroups of Sp(2n,Q) for 1 <= n <= 11 up to conjugacy in GL(2n,Q).

entry.title: Blocks with Equal Height Zero Degrees
entry.summary: We study blocks all of whose height zero ordinary characters have the same degree. We suspect that these might be the Broue-Puig nilpotent blocks.

entry.title: Quasimorphisms and laws
entry.summary: Stable commutator length vanishes in any group that obeys a law.

entry.title: On the lower central factors of groups
entry.summary: A general method for calculating or constructing lower central factors of groups is presented. {\it Relative basic commutators} are defined.

entry.title: A 3-local characterization of Co_2
entry.summary: Conway's second largest simple group, $\Co_2$, is characterized by the centralizer of an element of order 3 and certain fusion data.

entry.title: Geometry of the mapping class group II: A biautomatic structure
entry.summary: The mapping class group of a non-exceptional oriented surface of finite type admits a biautomatic structure.

entry.title: Subgroups of R. Thompson's Group F that are Isomorphic to F
entry.summary: This paper studies when a pair of elements in F are the images of the standard generators of F under a self monomorphism.

entry.title: Normal restriction in finite groups
entry.summary: In this paper, we will prove some sufficient conditions for the solvability of groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, to appear in Communications in Algebra

entry.title: The Differential and Functional Equations for a Lie Group Homomorphism are Equivalent
entry.summary: I prove the "folklore" result that the functional equation for a Lie group homomorphism can be solved by solving the corresponding differential equation.

entry.title: A Bers-like proof of the existence of train tracks for free group automorphisms
entry.summary: Using Lipschitz distance on Outer space we give another proof of the train track theorem.

entry.title: Extensions of Finite Abelian Groups
entry.summary: We study group extensions of Finite Abelian Groups using matrices. We also prove a Theorem for equivalence of extensions using matrices.

entry.title: Equational quasigroup definitions
entry.summary: Quasigroup equational definitions are given.

entry.title: On the endomorphism monoid of a profinite semigroup
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient conditions are given for the endomorphism monoid of a profinite semigroup to be profinite. A similar result is established for the automorphism group.

entry.title: A remark on the capability of finite $p$-groups
entry.summary: In this paper we classify all capable finite $p$-groups with derived subgroup of order $p$ and $G/G'$ of rank $n-1$.

entry.title: A note on topological amenability
entry.summary: We point out a simple characterisation of topological amenability in terms of bounded cohomology, following Johnson's reformulation of amenability.

entry.title: The rank of the endomorphism monoid of uniformly nested partition
entry.summary: We show that the rank of the endomorphism monoid of a unifromly nested partition of depth k is 2k.

entry.title: About the metric approximation of Higman's group
entry.summary: We prove that Higman's group does not embed into a metric ultraproduct of finite groups with a commutator-contractive invariant length function.

entry.title: An elementary proof that subgroups of free groups are free
entry.summary: We provide an elementary proof that subgroups of free groups are free via group actions.

entry.title: An Inaccessible Graph
entry.summary: An inaccessible, vertex transitive, locally finite graph is described. This graph is not quasi-isometric to a Cayley graph.

entry.title: The asymptotic density of dead ends in non-amenable groups
entry.summary: We show that, in non-amenable groups, the density of elements of depth at least $d$ goes to $0$ exponentially in $d$.

entry.title: A finitely presented orderable group with insoluble word problem
entry.summary: We construct a finitely presented (two-sided) totally orderable group with insoluble word problem.

entry.title: Almost regular involutory automorphisms of uniquely 2-divisible groups
entry.summary: We prove that a uniquely 2-divisible group that admits an almost regular involutory automorphism is solvable.

entry.title: Nielsen equivalence in closed surface groups
entry.summary: Any two generating systems of the fundamental group of a closed surface are Nielsen equivalent.

entry.title: Group rings whose group of units is hyperbolic
entry.summary: We study those group rings whose group of units is hyperbolic.

entry.title: Distortion in Free Nilpotent Groups
entry.summary: We prove that a subgroup of a finitely generated free nilpotent group F is undistorted if and only if it is a retract of a subgroup of finite index in F.

entry.title: Space functions of groups
entry.summary: We study the interrelation of space functions of groups and the space complexity of the algorithmic word problem in groups.

entry.title: Coverings of the Symmetric and Alternating Groups
entry.summary: We analyse for which $n$ there exist in $G=A_n,S_n$ two proper subgroups $H,K$ such that $G$ is the union of the $G$-conjugacy classes of $H$ and $K$.

entry.title: A Package of Programs for Determination of Some Classes of Subgroupoids
entry.summary: We give three programs on computer for finding the subgroupoids, wide subgroupoids and normal subgroupoids of a finite groupoid.

entry.title: Examples of Abel Grassmann's groupoids
entry.summary: In this article we have constructed some examples of some classes of AG-groupoids

entry.title: A Groupoid Structure on a Vector Space
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce the concept of generalized vector groupoid. Several properties of them are established.

entry.title: On class preserving automorphisms of groups of order 32
entry.summary: We study class preserving automorphisms of groups of order thirty two and prove that only two groups have non-inner class preserving automorphisms.

entry.title: Volume vs. rank of lattices
entry.summary: We show the rank (i.e. minimal size of a generating set) of lattices cannot grow faster than the volume.

entry.title: Cyclically regular semigroups
entry.summary: We study varieties of semigroups related to completely 0-simple semigroup. We present here an algorithmic descriptions of these varieties interms of "forbidden" semigroups.

entry.title: Hyperbolic hydra
entry.summary: We give examples of hyperbolic groups with finite-rank free subgroups of huge (Ackermannian) distortion.

entry.title: Property (T) with respect to non-commutative Lp-spaces
entry.summary: We show that a group with Kazhdan's property $(T)$ has property $(T_{B})$ for $B$ the Haagerup non-commutative $L_{p}(\mathcal{M})$-space associated with a von Neumann algebra $\mathcal{M}$, $1

entry.title: Rooted trees, strong cofinality and ample generics
entry.summary: We characterize those countable rooted trees whose full automorphism group has uncountable strong cofinality or contains an open subgroup with ample generics.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1105.1224

entry.title: On F-hypercentral and F-hypereccentric modules for finite soluble groups
entry.summary: I prove the group theory analogues of some Lie and Leibniz algebra results on F-hypercentral and F-hypereccentric modules.

entry.title: A Generic Identification Theorem for Groups of Finite Morley Rank, Revisited
entry.summary: This paper contains a stronger version of a final identification theorem for the `generic' groups of finite Morley rank.

entry.title: Enumerating limit groups: A Corrigendum
entry.summary: We discuss two possible interpretations of Definition 1.1 from \cite{GW}.

entry.title: Identities and quasiidentities in the lattice of overcommutative semigroup varieties
entry.summary: We describe overcommutative varieties of semigroups whose lattice of overcommutative subvarieties satisfies a non-trivial identity or quasiidentity. These two properties turn out to be equivalent.

entry.title: An identification theorem for the sporadic simple groups F_2 and M(23)
entry.summary: We identify the sporadic groups M(23) and F_2 from the approximate structure of the centralizer of an element of order 3.

entry.title: On the power pseudovariety $\mathbf{PCS}$
entry.summary: Some new semantic and syntactic characterizations of the members of the power pseudovariety $\mathbf{PCS}$ are obtained. This leads in particular to new algorithms for deciding membership in $\mathbf{PCS}$.

entry.title: On the Frattini lemma
entry.summary: Let $K$ be a subgroup of a finite group $G$, and suppose that $G=KN_G(P)$ for every Sylow subgroup $P$ of $K$. Then the subgroup $K$ is normal in $G$.

entry.title: Unramified Brauer groups and isoclinism
entry.summary: We show that if $G_1$ and $G_2$ are isoclinic groups, then their Bogomolov multipliers are isomorphic.

entry.title: On the lattice of subgroups of the lamplighter group
entry.summary: The paper is devoted to the study of the lattice of subgroups of the Lamplighter type groups and to the relative gradient rank.

entry.title: An exotic group with the Haagerup property
entry.summary: We prove the Haagerup property for an infinite discrete group constructed using surgery on a Euclidean Tits building of type $\tilde A_2$.

entry.title: On Hall subgroups of a finite group
entry.summary: In the paper new criteria of existence and conjugacy of Hall subgroups of finite groups are given.

entry.title: Limits of finite homogeneous metric spaces
entry.summary: We classify the metric spaces that can be approximated by finite homogeneous ones.

entry.title: Golod-Shafarevich groups: a survey
entry.summary: In this paper we survey the main results about Golod-Shafarevich groups and their applications in algebra, number theory and topology.

entry.title: Brown's criterion in Bredon homology
entry.summary: We translate Brown's criterion for homological finiteness properties to the setting of Bredon homology.

entry.title: Analysis on flag manifolds and Sobolev inequalities
entry.summary: We present some new Sobolev inequalities on spheres corresponding to parabolic geometries of real rank-one semisimple Lie groups

entry.title: There is no upper bound for the diameter of the commuting graph of a finite group
entry.summary: We construct a family of finite special 2-groups which have commuting graph of increasing diameter

entry.title: An asymmetric generalisation of Artin monoids
entry.summary: We propose a slight weakening of the definitions of Artin monoids and Coxeter monoids. We study one `infinite series' in detail.

entry.title: Existence of an invariant measure on a hypergroup
entry.summary: We prove existence of an invariant measure on a hypergroup.

entry.title: Whitehead problems for words in $\ZZ^m \times F_n$
entry.summary: We solve the Whitehead problem for automorphisms, monomorphisms and endomorphisms in $\ZZ^m \times F_n$ after giving an explicit description of each of these families of transformations.

entry.title: Finite semigroups embed in finitely presented congruence-free monoids
entry.summary: We prove that every finite semigroup embeds in a finitely presented congruence-free monoid, and pose some questions around the Boone-Higman Conjecture.

entry.title: A countable series of bisimple $\mathcal{H}$-trivial finitely presented congruence-free monoids
entry.summary: We provide a countable series of bisimple $\mathcal{H}$-trivial finitely presented congruence-free monoids.

entry.title: The Cayley isomorphism property for groups of order 8p
entry.summary: For every prime $p>3$ we prove that $Q \times \mathbb{Z}_p$ and $\mathbb{Z}_2^3 \times \mathbb{Z}_p$ are DCI- groups. This result completes the description of CI-groups of order $8p$.

entry.title: On the splitting of a normalizer of a torus in symplectic groups
entry.summary: In this paper we find all symplectic groups and their maximal tori in which normalizer of a torus is split over the torus.

entry.title: Algebraic vector bundles on punctured affine spaces and smooth quadrics
entry.summary: We construct examples of non-isomorphic algebraic vector bundles on the punctured affine space with isomorphic pullbacks to the smooth quadric.

entry.title: Word Values in p-Adic and Adelic Groups
entry.summary: We study the sets of values of words in p-adic and adelic groups.

entry.title: Random graphs of free groups contain surface subgroups
entry.summary: A random graph of free groups contains a surface subgroup

entry.title: The Quantitative Characterization of Finite Simple Groups
entry.summary: In this report we summarize this work, all finite simple groups $G$ can determined uniformly using their orders $|G|$ and the set $\pi_e(G)$ of their element orders.

entry.title: Spherical quadratic equations in free metabelian groups
entry.summary: We prove that the Diophantine problem for spherical quadratic equations in free metabelian groups is solvable and, moreover, NP-complete

entry.title: Classification of subgroups isomorphic to PSL_2(27) in the Monster
entry.summary: We prove that the Monster does not contain any subgroup isomorphic to PSL_2(27).

entry.title: Describing groups using first-order language
entry.summary: We investigate two notions about descriptions of groups using first-order language: quasi-finite axiomatizability, concerning infinite groups, and polylogarithmic compressibility, concerning classes of finite groups.

entry.title: Abelian Carter subgroups in finite permutation groups
entry.summary: We show that a finite permutation group containing a regular abelian self-normalizing subgroup is soluble.

entry.title: An addendum to `A rigidity property for the set of all characters induced by valuations'
entry.summary: This corrects and amplifies some comments made in a paper by Robert Bieri and the author with the above title.

entry.title: New simple groups with a BN-pair
entry.summary: We show that there are simple groups with a spherical BN-pair of rank 2 which are non-Moufang and hence not of algebraic origin.

entry.title: Structure of the group preserving a bilinear form
entry.summary: We study the group of all linear automorphisms preserving an arbitrary bilinear form

entry.title: Finitely presented subgroups of systolic groups are systolic
entry.summary: In this note we prove that every finitely presented subgroup of a systolic group is itself systolic.

entry.title: Presentations with negative deficiency and largeness
entry.summary: We extend the results of M. Edjvet on balanced presentations and largeness by giving conditions under which presentations with negative deficiency define large groups.

entry.title: An Example of a Right Loop Admitting Only Discrete Topolization
entry.summary: Being motivated by \cite{sk} and \cite{nms}, an example of a right loop admitting only discrete topolization is given.

entry.title: Camina pairs that are not $p$-closed
entry.summary: We show for every prime $p$ that there exists a Camina pair $(G,N)$ where $N$ is a $p$-group and $G$ is not $p$-closed.

entry.title: On the Congruences in Right Loops
entry.summary: In case the stability relation is a congruence, a necessary and also a sufficient condition for its equality with the center congruence is given.

entry.title: On some residual properties of Baumslag -- Solitar groups
entry.summary: A survey of results on the residual properties of Baumslag -- Solitar groups which have been obtained to date.

entry.title: On groups with locally compact asymptotic cones
entry.summary: We show how a recent result of Hrushovsky implies that if an asymptotic cone of a finitely generated group is locally compact, then the group is virtually nilpotent.

entry.title: Short and biased introduction to groupoids
entry.summary: The algebraic part of approach to groupoids started by S. Zakrzewski is presented.

entry.title: One formation of finite groups
entry.summary: It is shown that two formations of finite groups, one was introduced by V.S. Monakhov and V.N. Kniahina and another one was introduced by R. Brandl, are coincides.

entry.title: On categorical semigroups
entry.summary: The structure of categorical at zero semigroups is studied from the point of view their likeness to categories.

entry.title: The Cayley isomorphism property for groups of order p^3q
entry.summary: For every prime $p > 3$ and for every prime $q>p^3$ we prove that $\mathbb{Z}_q \times \mathbb{Z}_p^3$ is a DCI-group.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1301.6797

entry.title: Greendlinger's Lemma in cubical small cancellation theory
entry.summary: We give an alternative proof of Greendlinger's Lemma for C(6) small cancellation complexes. We prove the fundamental theorem of cubical small cancellation theory for C(9) cubical small cancellation complexes.

entry.title: Convexity of parabolic subgroups in Artin groups
entry.summary: We prove that any standard parabolic subgroup of any Artin group is convex with respect to the standard generating set.

entry.title: Hypergeometric Groups of Orthogonal Type
entry.summary: We obtain an infinite family of orthogonal hypergeometric groups, which are higher rank arithmetic groups. We also list cases of arithmetic hypergeometric groups whose real Zariski closure is O(2,3).

entry.title: Invariant random subgroups of strictly diagonal limits of finite symmetric groups
entry.summary: We classify the ergodic invariant random subgroups of strictly diagonal limits of finite symmetric groups.

entry.title: $K$-stable splendid Rickard complexes
entry.summary: In this paper, Brou\'e's conjecture is reduced to simple groups, with an additional stability condition.

entry.title: Groups, orders, and laws
entry.summary: We discuss the question whether left-orderable groups satisfying a nontrivial law are locally indicable.

entry.title: On identities in centrally nilpotent Moufang loops and centrally nilpotent A-loops
entry.summary: This paper proves that the variety generated by a centrally nilpotent Moufang loop (or centrally nilpotent A-loop) is finitely based.

entry.title: A one-relator group with long lower central series
entry.summary: A one-relator group with lower central series of length \omega^2 is constructed. This answers a problem of G. Baumslag.

entry.title: On transfinite nilpotence of the Vogel-Levine localization
entry.summary: We construct a finitely-presented group such that its Vogel-Levine localization is not transfinitely nilpotent. This answers a problem of J. P. Levine.

entry.title: Finite groups with all 3-maximal subgroups K-U-subnormal
entry.summary: A classification of finite groups in which every 3-maximal subgroup is K-U-subnormal is given.

entry.title: On the number of conjugacy classes of a permutation group
entry.summary: We prove that any permutation group of degree $n \geq 4$ has at most $5^{(n-1)/3}$ conjugacy classes.

entry.title: Using Hoare's Theorem to find the signature of a subgroup of an NEC group
entry.summary: We explain how to use Hoare's Theorem to find the signature of a subgroup of an NEC group. We give several examples.

entry.title: Sharply $2$-transitive groups
entry.summary: We give an explicit construction of sharply $2$-transitive groups with fixed point free involutions and without nontrivial abelian normal subgroup.

entry.title: Finite groups with generalized Ore supplement conditions for primary subgroups
entry.summary: We consider some applications of the theory of generalized Ore supplement conditions in the study of finite groups.

entry.title: Partitions of groups
entry.summary: We classify the subsets of a group by their sizes, formalize the basic methods of partitions and apply them to partition a group to subsets of prescribed sizes.

entry.title: Some characterizations of Howson PC-groups
entry.summary: We show that in the class of partially commutative groups, the conditions of being Howson, being fully residually free, and being free product of free-abelian groups, are equivalent.

entry.title: Aut(F2) puzzles
entry.summary: This paper studies Aut(F2) and groups closely related to it from a geometric perspective.

entry.title: Abelian splittings of Right-Angled Artin Groups
entry.summary: We characterize when (and how) a Right-Angled Artin group splits nontrivially over an abelian subgroup.

entry.title: Non-CLT groups of order $pq^3$
entry.summary: In this note we give a characterization of finite groups of order $pq^3$ ($p$, $q$ primes) that fail to satisfy the Converse of Lagrange's Theorem.

entry.title: On finite groups with dismantlable subgroup lattices
entry.summary: In this note we study the finite groups whose subgroup lattices are dismantlable.

entry.title: A classification of spherical conjugacy classes
entry.summary: Let G be a simple algebraic group over an algebraically closed field k. We classify the spherical conjugacy classes of G.

entry.title: Quasi-isometries of nilpotent groups
entry.summary: We prove that quasi-isometric finitely generated, torsion free nilpotent groups have isomorphic Mal'cev completions.

entry.title: Residually Torsion-Free Nilpotent One Relator Groups
entry.summary: We show that certain cyclically pinched one-relator groups are residually torsion-free nilpotent.

entry.title: Rank 3 Bingo
entry.summary: We classify irreducible actions of connected groups of finite Morley rank on abelian groups of Morley rank 3.

entry.title: Minsky machines and algorithmic problems
entry.summary: This is a survey of using Minsky machines to study algorithmic problems in semigroups, groups and other algebraic systems.

entry.title: Philip Hall's 'rather curious' formula and the Rogers-Ramanujan identities
entry.summary: We show that a strange group theoretical formula of Hall follows from the Rogers-Ramanujan identities.

entry.title: Contractbility of Outer space: reprise
entry.summary: This note contains a newly streamlined version of the original proof that Outer space is contractible.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of the Math Society of Japan Summer Institute 2014

entry.title: Finite Localities II
entry.summary: This paper continues the development of the theory of finite localities that was begun in "Finite Localities I". The emphasis in this Part 2.

entry.title: Prolongations of quasigroups
entry.summary: We give an overview of various prolongations of quasigroups. Two step prolongation procedure is proposed.

entry.title: Irreducible euclidean representations of Fibonacci groups
entry.summary: We show that every Hantzsche-Wendt group is an epimorphic image of a certain Fibonacci group.

entry.title: Sharply 3-transitive groups
entry.summary: We construct the first sharply $3$-transitive groups not arising from a near field, i.e. point stabilizers have no nontrivial abelian normal subgroup.

entry.title: Steiner loops of nilpotency class 2
entry.summary: We describe Steiner loops of nilpotency class two.

entry.title: Quasiprimitive groups containing a transitive alternating group
entry.summary: This paper classifies quasiprimitive permutation groups with a transitive subgroup which is isomorphic to $\A_n$ for some $n\geqslant5$.

entry.title: About spectrum of $T_2$-quasigroups
entry.summary: We give information about some properties and spectrum of quasigroups with the following identity $x(y \cdot yx) = y$.

entry.title: On operator norms for hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We estimate the operator norm of radial non-negative functions on hyperbolic groups. As a consequence, we show that several forms of Haagerup's inequality are optimal.

entry.title: Locally quadratic modules and minuscule representations
entry.summary: We give a new proof of a theorem by Timmesfeld showing that for simple algebraic groups, abstract modules where all roots act quadratically are direct sums of minuscule representations.

entry.title: Finite simple groups with some abelian Sylow subgroups
entry.summary: In this paper, we classify the finite simple groups with an abelian Sylow subgroup.

entry.title: A structural property of Adian inverse semigroups
entry.summary: We prove that an inverse semigroup over an Adian presentation is E-unitary.

entry.title: Algebraic properties of G-groupoids
entry.summary: The main purpose of this paper is to give a new definition for the notion of group-groupoid. Also, several basic properties of group-groupoids are established.

entry.title: On a generalization of the Gauss's formula
entry.summary: In this paper we study a group theoretical generalization of the well-known Gauss's formula that uses the generalized Euler's totient function introduced in [11].

entry.title: Alperin's Fusion Theorem for localities
entry.summary: In these notes we give an Alperin's Fusion Theorem for localities.

entry.title: Sharply 2-transitive groups in characteristic 0
entry.summary: We construct sharply 2-transitive groups of characteristic 0 without non-trivial abelian normal subgroup. These groups act sharply 2-trnaisitvely by conjugation on their involutions. This answers a longstanding open question.

entry.title: Medial quasigroups of prime square order
entry.summary: We prove that, for any prime $p$, there are precisely $2p^4-p^3-p^2-3p-1$ medial quasigroups of order $p^2$, up to isomorphism.

entry.title: Convergence actions and Specker compactifications
entry.summary: We study locally compact convergence groups, in particular the link between the convergence property and the Specker compactifications. We conclude with the existence of pullback spaces in some cases.

entry.title: Factorization numbers of finite rank $3$ abelian $p$-groups
entry.summary: In this short note we give a formula for the factorization number $F_2(G)$ of a finite rank $3$ abelian $p$-group $G$. This extends a result in our previous work \cite{9}.

entry.title: On the number of cyclic subgroup in finite groups
entry.summary: We study the number of cylic subgroups in finite groups and get that $G$ has $|G|-3$ cyclic subgroups if and only if $G \cong D_{10}$ or $Q_8$.

entry.title: Double centralizers in Artin-Tits groups
entry.summary: We prove an analogue of the Centralizer Theorem in the context of Artin-Tits groups.

entry.title: Finite groups with small number of cyclic subgroups
entry.summary: In this note, we study the finite groups with the number of cylic subgroups no greater than 6.

entry.title: Limits of Generalized Quaternion Groups
entry.summary: In the space of marked group, we determine the structure of groups which are limit points of the set of all generalized quaternion groups.

entry.title: Groups with at most twelve subgroups
entry.summary: We classify all of the groups with twelve or fewer subgroups. This paper is the proof of the entries in a submission to the Online Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences.

entry.title: Moufang Twin Trees of prime order
entry.summary: We prove that the unipotent horocyclic group of a Moufang twin tree of prime order is nilpotent of class at most 2.

entry.title: On a conjecture of Imrich and Müller
entry.summary: A conjecture of Imrich and M\"uller on rank of the intersection of subgroups of free groups is disproved.

entry.title: Classification of Imprimitive Irreducible Finite Sugroups of O(7)
entry.summary: This work gives a classification of imprimitive irreducible finite subgroups of the orthogonal group O(7) plus the number of conjugate classes for each group.

entry.title: Schreier's formula for Prosupersolvable groups
entry.summary: We classify the finitely generated prosupersolvable groups that satisfy Schreier's formula for the number of generators of open subgroups.

entry.title: Direct and Central Products of Localities
entry.summary: We develop a theory of direct and central products of partial groups and localities.

entry.title: On Intersection of Conjugate Subgoups
entry.summary: We give several algorithms addressing computations of intersections of conjugate subgroups.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1512.09185

entry.title: Almost Engel linear groups
entry.summary: We prove that if a linear group $G$ is almost Engel, then $G$ is finite-by-hypercentral. If $G$ is almost nil, then $G$ is finite-by-nilpotent.

entry.title: Finite Localities III
entry.summary: This third in the series establishes a category of finite localities.

entry.title: Les groupes de Mathieu sont-ils aussi sporadiques qu'il y parait ?
entry.summary: A plea to open again the building site of finite simple groups in order to include finite simple hypergroups.

entry.title: Homological finiteness properties of fibre products
entry.summary: We study the homological finiteness property FPn of fibre products

entry.title: Surgery on discrete groups
entry.summary: We study constructions of groups, in particular of groups of intermediate rank, which are accessible to surgery techniques.

entry.title: Non-elementary convergence groups are acylindrically hyperbolic
entry.summary: We proved that non-elementary discrete convergence groups are acylindrically hyperbolic.

entry.title: A survey of configurations
entry.summary: The present paper is an expository account of the notion of configurations and related topics, including amenability, paradoxical decomposition and the group theoretical properties.

entry.title: 3k-4 theorem for ordered groups
entry.summary: Recently, G. A. Freiman, M. Herzog, P. Longobardi, M. Maj proved two `structure theorems' for ordered groups \cite{FHLM}. We give elementary proof of these two theorems.

entry.title: On the subexponential growth of groups acting on rooted trees
entry.summary: We show that every group in a large family of (not necessarily torsion) spinal groups acting on the ternary rooted tree is of subexponential growth.

entry.title: Unitary Groups as Stabilizers of Orbits
entry.summary: We show that a finite unitary group which has orbits spanning the whole space is necessarily the setwise stabilizer of a certain orbit.

entry.title: Semistability and CAT(0) Geometry
entry.summary: We explain why semistability of a one-ended proper CAT(0) space can be determined by the geodesic rays. This is applied to boundaries of CAT(0) groups.

entry.title: A characterization of ZM-groups
entry.summary: In this short note we give a characterization of ZM-groups that uses the functions defined and studied in [3,4]. This leads to a proof of Conjecture 6 in [4].

entry.title: On Benjamini--Schramm limits of congruence subgroups
entry.summary: Every sequence of orbifolds corresponding to pairwise non-conjugate congruence lattices in a higher rank semisimple group over local fields of zero characteristic is Benjamini--Schramm convergent to the universal cover.

entry.title: Poly-freeness of even Artin groups of FC type
entry.summary: We prove that even Artin groups of FC type are poly-free and residually finite.

entry.title: Some model theory of profinite groups
entry.summary: We give some background on uniform pro-p groups and the model theory of profinite NIP groups.

entry.title: On right conjugacy closed loops of twice prime order
entry.summary: The right conjugacy closed loops of order 2p, where p is an odd prime, are classified up to isomorphism.

entry.title: The asymptotic dimension of box spaces of virtually nilpotent groups
entry.summary: We show that every box space of a virtually nilpotent group has asymptotic dimension equal to the Hirsch length of that group.

entry.title: Applications of Lie ring methods to group theory
entry.summary: This is an old article of 2000. Its aim is to illustrate how a Lie-theoretic result of Zelmanov enables one to treat various problems in group theory.

entry.title: The (2,4,5) triangle Coxeter group is not systolic
entry.summary: We show that the (2,4,5) triangle Coxeter group is not systolic.

entry.title: The automorphism group of a nonsplit metacyclic 2-group
entry.summary: We determine the structure of automorphism group or each nonsplit metacyclic 2-group. This completes the work on automorphism groups of metacyclic $p$-groups.

entry.title: Random group cobordisms of rank 7/4
entry.summary: We construct a model of random groups of rank 7/4, and show that in this model the random group has the exponential mesoscopic rank property.

entry.title: A step towards Twist Conjecture
entry.summary: Under the assumption that a defining graph of a Coxeter group admits only twists in $\mathbb{Z}_2$ and is of type FC, we prove M\"uhlherr's Twist Conjecture.

entry.title: Gaschütz Lemma for Compact Groups
entry.summary: We prove the Gasch\"utz Lemma holds for all metrizable compact groups.

entry.title: Divergence of Thompson groups
entry.summary: We prove that R. Thompson groups F, T, V have linear divergence functions.

entry.title: F-quasigroups isotopic to groups
entry.summary: In math.GR/0510298, we showed that every loop isotopic to an F-quasigroup is a Moufang loop. Here we characterize, via two simple identities, the class of F-quasigroups which are isotopic to groups. We call these quasigroups FG-quasigroups. We show that FG-quasigroups are linear over groups. We then use this fact to describe their structure. This gives us, for instance, a complete description of the simple FG-quasigroups. Finally, we show an equivalence of equational classes between pointed FG-quasigroups and central generalized modules over a particular ring.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages; refers to math.GR/0510298 and math.GR/0512244

entry.title: Fillings, finite generation and direct limits of relatively hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We examine the relationship between finitely and infinitely generated relatively hyperbolic groups, in two different contexts. First, we elaborate on a remark from math.GR/0601311, which states that the version of Dehn filling in relatively hyperbolic groups proved in math.GR/0510195, allowing infinitely generated parabolic subgroups, follows from the version with finitely generated parabolics. Second, we observe that direct limits of relatively hyperbolic groups are in fact direct limits of finitely generated relatively hyperbolic groups. We use this (and known results) to derive some consequences about the Strong Novikov Conjecture for groups as constructed in math.GR/0411039.
entry.arxiv:comment: (v1)10 pages. (v2) 11 pages, to appear in Groups, Geometry and Dynamics

entry.title: Cellular Automata on Group Sets
entry.summary: We introduce and study cellular automata whose cell spaces are left-homogeneous spaces. Examples of left-homogeneous spaces are spheres, Euclidean spaces, as well as hyperbolic spaces acted on by isometries; uniform tilings acted on by symmetries; vertex-transitive graphs, in particular, Cayley graphs, acted on by automorphisms; groups acting on themselves by multiplication; and integer lattices acted on by translations. For such automata and spaces, we prove, in particular, generalisations of topological and uniform variants of the Curtis-Hedlund-Lyndon theorem, of the Tarski-F{\o}lner theorem, and of the Garden-of-Eden theorem on the full shift and certain subshifts. Moreover, we introduce signal machines that can handle accumulations of events and using such machines we present a time-optimal quasi-solution of the firing mob synchronisation problem on finite and connected graphs.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is my doctoral dissertation. It consists of extended versions of the articles arXiv:1603.07271 [math.GR], arXiv:1603.06460 [math.GR], arXiv:1603.07272 [math.GR], arXiv:1701.02108 [math.GR], arXiv:1706.05827 [math.GR], and arXiv:1706.05893 [cs.FL]

entry.title: Rigidity of Right-Angled Coxeter Groups
entry.summary: If S and S' are two finite sets of Coxeter generators for a right-angled Coxeter group W, then the Coxeter systems (W,S) and (W,S') are equivalent.
entry.arxiv:comment: Errors corrected. The main result of this paper has been superseded by math.GR/0203170

entry.title: Spectra of non-commutative dynamical systems and graphs related to fractal groups
entry.summary: We study spectra of noncommutative dynamical systems, representations of fractal groups, and regular graphs. We explicitly compute these spectra for five examples of groups acting on rooted trees, and in three cases obtain totally disconnected sets.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: C. R. Acad. Sci. Paris Ser. I Math. 331 (2000), no. 6, 429--434

entry.title: Supercharacter theories and Schur rings
entry.summary: Diaconis and Isaacs have defined the supercharacter theories of a finite group to be certain approximations to the ordinary character theory of the group. We make explicit the connection between supercharacter theories and Schur rings, and we provide supercharacter theory constructions which correspond to Schur ring constructions of Leung and Man and of Tamaschke.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is reworked from "Constructions of supercharacter theories," arXiv:0905.3538v1 [math.GR], including new material on Schur rings and on superinduction

entry.title: On the mod p reduction of orthogonal representations
entry.summary: We show that the reduction mod p of an orthogonal linear representation is orthogonal, and we generalize this fact to representations of algebras with involution.The proofs make an essential use of the notion of " middle lattices ".
entry.arxiv:comment: paper dedicated to the memory of B. Kostant; second version : misprints corrected; different proof of th.4.2.1; added reference to a paper of Thompson

entry.title: F-quasigroups and generalized modules
entry.summary: In math.GR/0510298, we showed that every F-quasigroup is linear over a special kind of Moufang loop called an NK-loop. Here we extend this relationship by showing an equivalence between the equational class of (pointed) F-quasigroups and the equational class corresponding to a certain notion of generalized module (with noncommutative, nonassociative addition) for an associative ring.

entry.title: On the Burnside problem on periodic groups
entry.summary: It is proved that the free $m$-generated Burnside groups $\Bbb{B}(m,n)$ of exponent $n$ are infinite provided that $m>1$, $n\ge2^{48}$.

entry.title: Musings on Magnus
entry.summary: The object of this paper is to describe a simple method for proving that certain groups are residually torsion-free nilpotent, to describe some new parafree groups and to raise some new problems in honour of the memory of Wilhelm Magnus.
entry.arxiv:comment: AMS-Tex, 8 pages, no figures. To appear in Trans. Am. Math. Soc

entry.title: Commutators as Powers in Free Products of Groups
entry.summary: The ways in which a nontrivial commutator can be a proper power in a free product of groups are identified.

entry.title: The Geometry of Cycles in the Cayley Diagram of a Group
entry.summary: A study of triangulations of cycles in the Cayley diagrams of finitely generated groups leads to a new geometric characterization of hyperbolic groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: AMS-Tex, 9 pages, no figures. To be published in Contemporary Mathematics, The Mathematical Legacy of Wilhelm Magnus

entry.title: The second bounded cohomology of a group with infinitely many ends
entry.summary: We study the second bounded cohomology of an amalgamated free product of groups, and an HNN extension of a group. As an application, we have a group with infinitely many ends has infinite dimensional second bounded cohomology.

entry.title: Disjunctive identities of finite groups and identities of regular representations
entry.summary: In this paper we explicitly compute finite bases of disjunctive identities and finite bases of regular representations for a number of interesting finite groups.

entry.title: Formal Languages and Infinite Groups
entry.summary: This article is an introduction to formal languages from the point of view of combinatorial group theory. Group theoretic applications are included and language classes are defined algebraically.
entry.arxiv:comment: DVI file, 25 pages. To appear in "Geometric and Computational Perspectives on Infinite Groups"

entry.title: Infinite products of finite simple groups
entry.summary: We classify those sequences $\langle S_{n} \mid n \in \mathbb{N} \rangle$ of finite simple nonabelian groups such that the full product $\prod_{n} S_{n}$ has property (FA).
entry.arxiv:comment: AMS-LaTex file, 44 pages. To appear in Tran. Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: An Algebraic Annulus Theorem
entry.summary: We present an extension of Dunwoody's theory of tracks and use it to prove an analogue of the annulus theorem for hyperbolic groups.

entry.title: Rewriting Systems and Geometric 3-Manifolds
entry.summary: The fundamental groups of most (conjecturally, all) closed 3-manifolds with uniform geometries have finite complete rewriting systems. The fundamental groups of a large class of amalgams of circle bundles also have finite complete rewriting systems. The general case remains open.

entry.title: Solvable Baumslag-Solitar Groups Are Not Almost Convex
entry.summary: The arguments of Cannon, Floyd, Grayson and Thurston showing that solve geometry groups are not almost convex also show that solvable Baumslag-Solitar groups are not almost convex.

entry.title: Buildings, group extensions and the cohomology of congruence subgroups
entry.summary: We use buildings and group extensions to compute lower bounds on the top Betti numbers for the cohomology of the level p congruence subgroups of SL(3,Z) and Sp(4,Z).

entry.title: A non-quasiconvexity embedding theorem for hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We show that if $G$ is a non-elementary torsion-free word hyperbolic group then there exists another word hyperbolic group $G^*$, such that $G$ is a subgroup of $G^*$ but $G$ is not quasiconvex in $G^*$.
entry.arxiv:comment: AMS-TeX, 29 pages; figures are included is the Post-Script file

entry.title: The ubiquity of Thompson's group F in groups of piecewise linear homeomorphisms of the unit interval
entry.summary: We show that Thompson's group F occurs with great frequency in the group of PL homeomorphisms of the unit interval.

entry.title: Liftez les Sylows! Une suite à ``Sous-groupes periodiques d'un groupe stable''
entry.summary: If $G$ is an omega-stable group with a normal definable subgroup $H$, then the Sylow-$2$-subgroups of $G/H$ are the images of the Sylow-$2$-subgroups of $G$.

entry.title: Length and Area Functions on Groups and Quasi-Isometric Higman Embeddings
entry.summary: We survey recent results about asymptotic functions of groups, obtained by the authors in collaboration with J.-C.Birget, V. Guba and E. Rips. We also discuss methods used in the proofs of these results.

entry.title: On groups whose word problem is solved by a nested stack automaton
entry.summary: Accessible groups for which the language of all words defining the identity is accepted by a certain class of nested stack automata are virtually free.

entry.title: Alternating Quotients of Fuchsian Groups
entry.summary: It is shown that any finitely generated non-elementary Fuchsian group has among its homomorphic images all but finitely many of the alternating groups. This settles in the affirmative a conjecture of Graham Higman.

entry.title: Instability of the virtual solvability and the property of being virtually torsion-free for quasi-isometric groups
entry.summary: We construct examples of groups showing that virtual solvability and the property of being virtually torsion-free are not preserved by bi-Lipschitz maps and hence by quasi-isometries.

entry.title: Rigidity property of diagram groups
entry.summary: We show a rigid connection between two classical objects: the R.Thompson group F and the Dunce hat. A diagram group of a directed 2-complex contains a copy of F if and only if the complex contains a copy of the Dunce hat.

entry.title: Geometry and dynamics on the free solvable groups
entry.summary: The new model for the free solvable groups of level two is given; this helps to calculate the Poisson-Furstenberg boundary of the group.

entry.title: Groups isomorphic to all their non-trivial normal subgroups
entry.summary: In answer to a question of P. Hall, we supply another construction of a group which is isomorphic to each of its non-trivial normal subgroups.

entry.title: On the Definition of Word Hyperbolic Groups
entry.summary: Formal languages based on the multiplication tables of finitely generated groups are investigated and used to give a linguistic characterization of word hyperbolic groups.

entry.title: On the relation of the monomial group with other algebraic structures
entry.summary: It is shown in what way monomial group connects Abelian group Z^{n} and total linear group GL(n). It is shown that any subgroup of Abelian group Z^{n} induces subgroup of monomial group $S_{2}\wr S_n}$, which in its turn induces corresponding subgroup of GL_{n}(R).

entry.title: On the asymptotics of drift
entry.summary: We prove that there exist infinitely many asymptotics of drift for random walks on finitely generated groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages; to appear in Zapiski Sem. POMI, revised version

entry.title: Equivalence of Geometric and Combinatorial Dehn Functions
entry.summary: We prove that if a finitely presented group acts properly discontinuously, cocompactly and by isometries on a simply connected Riemannian manifold, then the Dehn function of the group and the corresponding filling function of the manifold are equivalent, in a sense described below.

entry.title: On the Andrews-Curtis conjecture and algorithms from topology
entry.summary: We relate the Andrews-Curtis conjecture to the triviality problem for balanced presentations of groups using algorithms from 3-manifold topology. Implementing this algorithm could lead to counterexamples to the Andrews-Curtis conjecture.

entry.title: Commensurability of graph products
entry.summary: We define graph products of families of pairs of groups and study the question when two such graph products are commensurable. As an application we prove linearity of certain graph products.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Algebraic and Geometric Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/agt/AGTVol1/agt-1-30.abs.html

entry.title: Cohomoloy of $Aut(F_n)$
entry.summary: We calculate the homology of automorphism groups of free groups in various cases. The author would like to thank his thesis advisor Karen Vogtmann.
entry.arxiv:comment: The author's Ph.D. dissertation at Cornell in 1998

entry.title: Cohomologie equivariante des varietes de Bott-Samelson
entry.summary: In this text, We compute the equivariant cohomology of Bott-Samelson varieties. Thanks to this computation, we give a new demonstration for the formulas proved by Sarah Billey for the equivariant cohomology of Schubert varieties.

entry.title: Bounded rank subgroups of Coxeter groups, Artin groups and one-relator groups with torsion
entry.summary: We obtain a number of results regarding freeness, quasiconvexity and separability for subgroups of Coxeter groups, Artin groups and one-relator groups with torsion.

entry.title: The conjugacy and isomorphism problems for combable groups
entry.summary: There exist combable groups in which the conjugacy problem is unsolvable. The isomorphism problem is unsolvable for certain recursive sequences of finite presentations of combable groups.

entry.title: Representing braids by automorphisms
entry.summary: Based on a normal form for braid group elements suggested by Dehornoy, we prove several representations of braid groups by automorphisms of a free group to be faithful. This includes a simple proof of the standard Artin's representation being faithful.

entry.title: A Note on Trimedial Quasigroups
entry.summary: The purpose of this brief note is to sharpen a result of Kepka about the axiomization of the variety of trimedial quasigroups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, AMS-LaTeX, submitted to_Quasigroups and Related Systems_

entry.title: Commutants of Bol loops of Odd Order
entry.summary: In this note we show that the commutant of a Bol loop of odd order is a subloop.

entry.title: A note on Closure Operators in Category of Groups
entry.summary: We give some applications of closure operators in category of groups and link them with the join problem of subnormal subgroups.

entry.title: Groupes satisfaisant une condition nilpotence
entry.summary: In this Note we study the groups $G$ satisfying condition $(\mathcal{N},n)$, that is, every subset of $G$ with $n+1$ elements contains a pair $\{x,y\}$ such that the subgroup $<x,y>$ is nilpotent.

entry.title: Navigating the Cayley graph of SL(2,Z/pZ)
entry.summary: This paper describes a non-deterministic polynomial-time algorithm to find a path of length O(log p loglog p) between any two vertices of the Cayley graph of SL(2,Z/pZ).

entry.title: Variations on Van Kampen's method
entry.summary: We give a detailed account of the classical Van Kampen method for computing presentations of fundamental groups of complements of complex algebraic curves, and of a variant of this method, working with arbitrary projections (even with vertical asymptotes).

entry.title: Une (nouvelle ?) construction du groupe de réflexion complexe $G_{31}$
entry.summary: In Shephard-Todd classification of finite (complex) reflection groups, the group $G_{31}$ appears to be the unique one in rank 4 of order 46080. We provide here an elementary construction starting from the Weyl group of type $B_6$.

entry.title: A Remark on "Counting primitive elements in free groups" (by J. Burillo and E. Ventura)
entry.summary: We observe that a sharp result on the exponential growth rate of the number of primitive elements exists for the free group on two generators.

entry.title: The Dehn Function of PSL(2,Z[1/p])
entry.summary: We show that PSL(2,Z[1/p]) admits a combing with bounded asynchronous width, and use this combing to show that PSL(2,Z[1/p]) has an exponential Dehn function. As a corollary, PSL(2,Z[1/p]) has solvable word problem and is not an automatic group.

entry.title: On co-Hopfian nilpotent groups
entry.summary: We characterize co-Hopfian finitely generated torsion free nilpotent groups in terms of their Lie algebra automorphisms, and construct many examples of such groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, to appear in Bull. London Math. Soc

entry.title: Products of characters and finite p-groups
entry.summary: Let G be a finite p-group, where p is a prime number, and $\chi$ and $\psi$ be faithful complex irreducible characters of G. We study the relation between the number $\eta(\chi,\psi)$ of distinct irreducible constituents of the product $\chi \psi$ and p.

entry.title: On sofic groups
entry.summary: Answering some queries of Weiss, we prove that the free product and amenable extensions of sofic groups are sofic as well, and give an example of a finitely generated sofic group that is not residually amenable.

entry.title: Dense Random Finitely Generated Subgroups of Lie Groups
entry.summary: Let G be a connected real Lie group of dimension n. Then there exists a relatively compact open neighbourhood W of e in G such that for n+1 randomly chosen elements g_0,..,g_n the generated subgroup will be dense in G with probability one.

entry.title: Solvable groups with a given solvable length, and minimal composition length
entry.summary: Let c(d) denote the minimal composition length of all finite solvable groups with solvable (or derived) length d. We prove that c(d) equals 0,1,2,4,5,7,8,13,15 when d=0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8.

entry.title: On controllers of prime ideals in group algebras of torsion-free abelian groups of finite rank
entry.summary: In the presented paper we consider some methods of studying of prime ideals in group algebras of abelian groups of finite rank

entry.title: Permutation groups of prime degree, a quick proof of Burnside's theorem
entry.summary: A transitive permutation group of prime degree is doubly transitive or solvable. We give a direct proof of this theorem by Burnside which uses neither S-ring type arguments, nor representation theory.

entry.title: A Combination Theorem for Relatively Hyperbolic Groups
entry.summary: In this paper we give new requirements that a tree of $\delta$-hyperbolic spaces has to satisfy in order to be $\delta$-hyperbolic itself. As an application, we give a simple proof that limit groups are relatively hyperbolic.

entry.title: a-T-menability of groups acting on trees
entry.summary: We present some partial results concerning a-T-menability of groups acting on trees. Various known results are given uniform proofs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, no figures. accepted by the Bulletin of the Australian Mathematical Society
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bulletin of the Australian Mathematical Society, Vol. 69 (2004) pp. 297--303

entry.title: Weak Identities in finitely generated groups
entry.summary: In this article we introduce the notion of weak identities in a group and study their properties. We show that weak identities have some similar properties to ordinary ones. We use this notion to prove that any finitely generated solvable discriminating group is abelian.

entry.title: Explicit presentations for exceptional braid groups
entry.summary: We give presentations for the braid groups associated with the complex reflection groups $G_{24}$ and $G_{27}$. For the cases of $G_{29}$, $G_{31}$, $G_{33}$ and $G_{34}$, we give (strongly supported) conjectures. These presentations were obtained with VKCURVE, a GAP package implementing Van Kampen's method.

entry.title: Non-hopfian relatively free groups
entry.summary: To solve problems of Gilbert Baumslag and Hanna Neumann, posed in the 1960's, we construct a nontrivial variety of groups all of whose noncyclic free groups are non-hopfian.

entry.title: A Lie Group without universal covering
entry.summary: We present an example of a disconnected Lie group for which there is no universal covering (as Lie group).
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 2 pages. Revised version. A small, but crucial mistake in the formula defining the group structure needed to be corrected

entry.title: Achievable ranks of intersections of finitely generated free groups
entry.summary: We answer a question due to A. Myasnikov by proving that all expected ranks occur as the ranks of intersections of finitely generated subgroups of free groups.

entry.title: Relative hyperbolicity and right-angled Coxeter groups
entry.summary: We show that right-angled Coxeter groups are relatively hyperbolic in the sense defined by Farb, relative to a natural collection of rank-2 parabolic subgroups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 2 figures; submitted to Math. Annalen

entry.title: Delzant's variation on Scott complexity
entry.summary: We give an exposition of Delzant's ideas extending the notion of Scott complexity of finitely generated groups to surjective homomorphisms of finitely presented groups to finitely generated groups.

entry.title: Products of Characters and Finite $p$-groups III
entry.summary: Let $G$ be a finite $p$-group and $\chi,\psi$ be irreducible characters of $G$. We study the character $\chi\psi$ when $\chi\psi$ has at most $p-1$ distinct irreducible constituents.

entry.title: Quasi-isometric rigidity of higher rank S-arithmetic lattices
entry.summary: We show that S-arithmetic lattices in semisimple Lie groups with no rank one factors are quasi-isometrically rigid.

entry.title: A topological Tits alternative
entry.summary: Let k be a local field, and G a linear group over k. We prove that either G contains a relatively open solvable subgroup, or it contains a relatively dense free subgroup. This result has applications in dynamics, Riemannian foliations and profinite groups.

entry.title: Bijective Quasi-Isometries of Amenable Groups
entry.summary: Whyte showed that any quasi-isometry between non-amenable groups is a bounded distance from a bijection. In contrast this paper shows that for amenable groups, inclusion of a proper subgroup of finite index is never a bounded distance from a bijection.

entry.title: Capable two-generator 2-groups of class two
entry.summary: A group is called capable if it is a central factor group. We characterize the capable 2-generator 2-groups of class 2 in terms of a standard presentation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pp; corrected some typos and incorrect terminology

entry.title: Subgroups of finitely presented groups with solvable conjugacy problem
entry.summary: We prove that every countable group with solvable power problem embeds into a finitely presented 2-generated group with solvable power and conjugacy problems.

entry.title: Non-linear residually finite groups
entry.summary: We give the first example of a non-linear residually finite 1-related group: < a, t | a^{t^2}=a^2>.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages. to appear in J. Algebra, 2004

entry.title: Almost unimodular systems on compact groups with disjoint spectra
entry.summary: We emulate the Rademacher functions on any non-commutative compact group requiring the resulting system to have pairwise disjoint spectra.

entry.title: Class-Preserving Automorphisms of a Family of Finite p-Groups
entry.summary: I withdraw my paper from arXiv because there is a technical error in the proof of Theorem 1.1. And because of this error, all the results in the paper are untrue. I am very sorry for this.

entry.title: Boundedness of Degree of the basic field of an arithmetic reflection group in Lobachevsky space
entry.summary: This paper have serious error in the proof of main theorem 1.1.Result is not proved.

entry.title: Nonvanishing of algebraic entropy for geometrically finite groups of isometries of Hadamard manifolds
entry.summary: We prove that any geometrically finite (nonelementary) group of isometries of a pinched Hadamard manifold has uniform exponential growth.

entry.title: Conjugacy separability of some one-relator groups
entry.summary: Conjugacy separability of any group of the class of one-relator groups given by the presentation $<a, b; [a^m,b^n]=1>$ ($m,n>1$) is proven.

entry.title: On the Automorphisms of Some One-Relator Groups
entry.summary: The description of the automorphism group of group $<a, b; [a^m,b^n]=1>$ ($m,n>1$) in terms of generators and defining relations is given. This result is applied to prove that any normal automorphism of every such group is inner.

entry.title: Contraction groups for tidy automorphisms of totally disconnected groups
entry.summary: We show that recent results of U. Baumgartner and G.A. Willis concerning contraction groups of automorphisms of metrizable, totally disconnected, locally compact groups remain valid also in the non-metrizable case, if one restricts attention to automorphisms for which small tidy subgroups exist.

entry.title: Generators for Arithmetic Groups
entry.summary: We prove that any non-cocompact irreducible lattice in a higher rank semi-simple Lie group contains a subgroup of finite index, which has three generators.

entry.title: Counting subgroups in a family of nilpotent semi-direct products
entry.summary: In this paper we compute the subgroup zeta functions of nilpotent semi-direct products of groups of the form $$G_n=<x_1,...,x_n,y_1,...,y_{n-1}|[x_i,x_n]=y_i, 1\leq i\leq n-1, \text{all other $[,]$ trivial}>$$ and deduce local functional equations.

entry.title: Normal subgroup growth in free class-2-nilpotent groups
entry.summary: Let $F_{2,d}$ denote the free class-2-nilpotent group on $d$ generators. We compute the normal zeta functions $\zeta^\triangleleft_{F_{2,d}}(s)$, prove that they satisfy local functional equations and determine their abscissae of convergence and pole orders.

entry.title: Arithmetic of algebraic groups
entry.summary: This thesis studies arithmetic of linear algebraic groups. It involves studying the properties of linear algebraic groups defined over global fields, local fields and finite fields, or more generally the study of the linear algebraic groups defined over the fields which admit arbitrary cyclic extensions.

entry.title: Relative Dehn functions of amalgamated products and HNN--extensions
entry.summary: We obtain an upper bound for relative Dehn functions of amalgamated products and HNN--extensions with respect to certain collections of subgroups. Our main results generalize the combination theorems for relatively hyperbolic groups proved by Dahmani.

entry.title: Polycyclic groups: A new platform for cryptology?
entry.summary: We propose a new cryptosystem based on polycyclic groups. The cryptosystem is based on the fact that the word problem can be solved effectively in polycyclic groups, while the known solutions to the conjugacy problem are far less efficient.

entry.title: From braid groups to mapping class groups
entry.summary: This paper is a survey of some properties of the braid groups and related groups that lead to questions on mapping class groups.

entry.title: Currents on free groups
entry.summary: We study the properties of geodesic currents on free groups, particularly the "intersection form" that is similar to Bonahon's notion of the intersection number between geodesic currents on hyperbolic surfaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: Updated version, to appear in AMS Contemporary Mathematics series

entry.title: Some results on capable groups of prime exponent and class two
entry.summary: This note collects several results on the capability of $p$-groups of class two and prime exponent. Among the new results, we settle the 4-generator case for this class.

entry.title: Groups with non-simply connected asymptotic cones
entry.summary: We construct a group (an HNN extension of a free group) with polynomial isoperimetric function, linear isodiametric function and non-simply connected asymptotic cones.

entry.title: On the residual nilpotence of pure Artin groups
entry.summary: In this very short note we show that the residual nilpotence of pure Artin groups of spherical type is easily deduced from the faithfulness of the Krammer-Digne representations.

entry.title: The normal zeta function of the free class two nilpotent group on four generators
entry.summary: We calculate explicitly the normal zeta function of the free class two nilpotent group on four generators. This has Hirsch length ten.

entry.title: On asymptotic dimension of countable abelian groups
entry.summary: We compute the asymptotic dimension of the rationals given with an invariant proper metric. Also, we show that a countable torsion abelian group taken with an invariant proper metric has asymptotic dimension zero.

entry.title: A proof that all Seifert 3-manifold groups and all virtual surface groups are conjugacy separable
