entry.summary: We prove that the fundamental group of any Seifert 3-manifold is conjugacy separable. That is, conjugates may be distinguished in finite quotients or, equivalently, conjugacy classes are closed in the pro-finite topology.

entry.title: Finite Groups of Uniform Logarithmic Diameter
entry.summary: We give an example of an infinite family of finite groups $G_n$ such that each $G_n$ can be generated by 2 elements and the diameter of every Cayley graph of $G_n$ is $O(\log (| G_{n}|))$. This answers a question of Lubotzky.

entry.title: Minimal volume entropy on graphs
entry.summary: Among the normalized metrics on a graph, we show the existence and the uniqueness of an entropy-minimizing metric, and give explicit formulas for the minimal volume entropy and the metric realizing it.

entry.title: On Residual Properties of Word Hyperbolic Groups
entry.summary: For a fixed word hyperbolic group we compare different residual properties related to quasiconvex subgroups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages. Final version: several typos corrected
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. of Group Theory 9 (2006), No. 5, pp. 695-714

entry.title: Traveller Salesman Property and Richard Thompson's Group $F$
entry.summary: Recently Akhmedov introduced a property of finitely generated groups called the Traveller Salesman Property (TSP). It was shown by Thurston that TSP implies non-amenability. Akhmedov conjectured that R. Thompson's group $F$ has TSP. The aim of this article is to disprove this conjecture.

entry.title: Permutation representations of the braid group commutator subgroup
entry.summary: We study the representations of the commutator subgroup of the braid group with n strands in the symmetric group of degree r. Motivated by some experimental results, we conjecture that for n>r, every such representation is trivial.

entry.title: Bounded cohomology, cross ratios and cocycles
entry.summary: We use cross ratios to describe second real continuous bounded cohomology for locally compact topological groups. We also derive a rigidity result for cocycles with values in the isometry group of a proper hyperbolic geodesic metric space.

entry.title: Deformed multiplication in the semigroup PT_n
entry.summary: Pairwise non isomorphic semigroups obtained from the semigroup PT_n of all partial transformations by the deformed multiplication proposed by Ljapin are classified.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bulletin of the University of Kiev, Series: Mechanics and Mathematics, nr. 11-12 (2004), 35-38 (Ukrainian)

entry.title: A product of trees as universal space for hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We show that every Gromov hyperbolic group $\Ga$ admits a quasi-isometric embedding into the product of $(n+1)$ binary trees, where $n=\dim\di\Ga$ is the topological dimension of the boundary at infinity of $\Ga$.

entry.title: Arithmetical Properties of Finite Groups
entry.summary: Let $G$ be a finite group and $Ch_i(G)$ some quantitative sets. In this paper we study the influence of $Ch_i(G)$ to the structure of $G$. We present a survey of author and his colleagues' recent works.

entry.title: The automorphism group of the sandwich inverse symmetric semigroup
entry.summary: The structure of the automorphism group of the sandwich semigroup IS_n is described in terms of standard group constructions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bulletin of the University of Kiev, Series: Mechanics and Mathematics, 2005, nr. 13-14, p.101-105

entry.title: A new graph related to conjugacy classes of finite groups
entry.summary: In this paper we classify the finite groups satisfying the following property $P_4$: their orders of representatives are set-wise relatively prime for any 4 distinct non-central conjugacy classes.

entry.title: On the residual solvability of generalized free products of finitely generated nilpotent groups
entry.summary: In this paper we study the residual solvability of the generalized free product of finitely generated nilpotent groups. We show that these kinds of structures are often residually solvable.

entry.title: On nilpotent subsemigroups in some matrix semigroups
entry.summary: We describe maximal nilpotent subsemigroups of a given nilpotency class in the semigroup $\Omega_n$ of all $n\times n$ real matrices with non-negative coefficients and the semigroup $\mathbf{D}_n$ of all doubly stochastic real matrices.

entry.title: On presentations of generalizations of braids with few generators
entry.summary: In his initial paper on braids E.Artin gave a presentation with two generators for an arbitrary braid group. We give analogues of this Artin's presentation for various generalizations of braids.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Fundamental and Applied Mathematics. Vol. 11, No 4, 2005. 23-32

entry.title: Elementarily free groups are subgroup separable
entry.summary: Elementarily free groups are the finitely generated groups with the same elementary theory as free groups. We prove that elementarily free groups are subgroup separable, answering a question of Zlil Sela.

entry.title: Sur le transfert des traces d'un groupe classique p-adique à un groupe linéaire tordu
entry.summary: The goal of this paper is to develop the combinatorics needed to understand in an explicit way the transfer between classical groups and general linear groups

entry.title: A Note on Parabolic Subgroups of a Coxeter Group
entry.summary: The aim of this note is to prove that the parabolic closure of any subset of a Coxeter group is a parabolic subgroup. To obtain that, several technical lemmas on the root system of a parabolic subgroup are established.

entry.title: Groupe a classes de conjugaisons infinies : quelques exemples
entry.summary: We consider the group property of being icc. We give several examples of icc groups and study its stability under usual algebraic constructions.

entry.title: On a free group of transformations defined by an automaton
entry.summary: We prove that three automorphisms of the rooted binary tree defined by a certain 3-state automaton generate a free non-Abelian group of rank 3.

entry.title: On representations of variants of semigroups
entry.summary: We construct a family of representations of an arbitrary variant $S_a$ of a semigroup $S$, induced by a given representation of $S$, and investigate properties of such representations and their kernels.

entry.title: Fundamental problems in the theory of infinite-dimensional Lie groups
entry.summary: In a preprint from 1982, John Milnor formulated various fundamental questions concerning infinite-dimensional Lie groups. In this note, we describe some of the answers (and partial answers) obtained in the preceding years.

entry.title: On the conjugacy problem for Carter subgroups
entry.summary: It is proven in the paper, that Carter subgroups of a finite group are conjugate if Carter subgroups in the group of induced automorphisms for every non-Abelian composition factor are conjugate.

entry.title: Arbitrarily large finite quotients imply no uniform bound on depth
entry.summary: We show that any group with arbitrarily large finite quotients admits generating sets with respect to which it has arbitrarily large finite dead-end depth. This extends a joint result with Riley and partially answers a question asked there.

entry.title: Algorithmic and asymptotic properties of groups
entry.summary: This is a survey of the recent work in algorithmic and asymptotic properties of groups. I discuss Dehn functions of groups, complexity of the word problem, Higman embeddings, and constructions of finitely presented groups with extreme properties (monsters).
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of ICM in Madrid, 22 pages

entry.title: Abelian Groups, Homomorphisms and Central Automorphisms of Nilpotent Groups
entry.summary: In this paper we find a necessary and sufficient condition for a finite nilpotent group to have an abelian central automorphism group.

entry.title: Cartesian products as profinite completions
entry.summary: We prove that if a Cartesian product of alternating groups is topologically finitely generated, then it is the profinite completion of a finitely generated residually finite group. The same holds for Cartesian producs of other simple groups under some natural restrictions.

entry.title: Relatively Hyperbolic Groups are $C^*$-simple
entry.summary: We characterize relatively hyperbolic groups whose reduced $C^*$-algebra is simple as those, which have no non-trivial finite normal subgroups.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. of Funct. Analysis 243 (2007), No. 1, pp. 345-351.

entry.title: On the existence of Carter subgroups
entry.summary: In the paper we obtain the existence criterion of a Carter subgroup in a finite group in terms of its normal series. An example showing that the criterion cannot be reformulated in terms of composition factors is given.

entry.title: Finite subgroups of arithmetic lattices in U(2,1)
entry.summary: The principle result of this article is the determination of the possible finite subgroups of arithmetic lattices in U(2,1).

entry.title: Automorphisms of finite Abelian groups
entry.summary: We give an accessible and modern description of the automorphisms of a finite abelian group $G$. Included is an explicit formula for the cardinality of $Aut(G)$.

entry.title: On non-locally connected boundaries of CAT(0) spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we study CAT(0) spaces with non-locally connected boundary. We give some condition of a CAT(0) space whose boundary is not locally connected.

entry.title: A Monstrous Proposal
entry.summary: We explain a conjecture relating the monster simple group to an algebraic variety that was discovered in a non-monstrous context.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 1 figure; revised version, as submitted for publication 2007

entry.title: Fixed Subgroups of Endomorphisms of Free Products
entry.summary: Let $G=\ast_{i=1}^{n}G_{i}$ and let $\phi$ be a symmetric endomorphism of $G$. If $\phi$ is a monomorphism or if $G$ is a finitely generated residually finite group, then the fixed subgroup $Fix(\phi)=\{g\in G:\phi(g)=g\}$ of $\phi$ has Kurosh rank at most $n$.

entry.title: Galois theory, graphs and free groups
entry.summary: A self-contained exposition is given of the topological and Galois-theoretic properties of the category of combinatorial 1-complexes, or graphs, very much in the spirit of Stallings. A number of classical, as well as some new results about free groups are derived.

entry.title: Non-nesting actions of Polish groups on pretrees
entry.summary: We study non-nesting actions of groups on real trees. We prove some fixed point theorems for such actions under the assumption that groups are Polish and have comeagre conjugacy classes.

entry.title: Stable commutator length in subgroups of PL(I)
entry.summary: Let G be a subgroup of PL(I). Then the stable commutator length of every element of [G,G] is zero.

entry.title: Asymptotic dimension of one relator groups
entry.summary: We show that one relator groups viewed as metric spaces with respect to the word-length metric have finite asymptotic dimension in the sense of Gromov and give an estimate of their asymptotic dimension in terms of the relator length.

entry.title: Elementary Equivalence of Endomorphism Rings of Abelian p-Groups
entry.summary: In this paper we study a relationship between elementary equivalence of endomorphism rings of Abelian p-groups and second order equivalence of the corresponding Abelian p-groups.

entry.title: Permutation presentations of modules over finite groups
entry.summary: We introduce a notion of permutation presentations of modules over finite groups, and completely determine finite groups over which every module has a permutation presentation. To get this result, we prove that every coflasque module over a cyclic p-group is permutation projective.

entry.title: On the isomorphism classes of transversals
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that there does not exist a subgroup H of a finite group G such that the number of isomorphism classes of right transversals of H in G is two.

entry.title: Finite $p$-groups of class 2 have noninner automorphisms of order $p$
entry.summary: We prove that for any prime number $p$, every finite non-abelian $p$-group $G$ of class 2 has a noninner automorphism of order $p$ leaving either the Frattini subgroup $\Phi(G)$ or $\Omega_1(Z(G))$ elementwise fixed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. to appear in Journal of Algebra

entry.title: Bi-orderings on pure braided Thompson's groups
entry.summary: In this paper it is proved that the pure braided Thompson's group BF admits a bi-order, analog to the bi-order of the pure braid groups.

entry.title: The Expected Order of a Random Unitary Matrix
entry.summary: Let M=M(n,q) be the average of the orders of the elements in the finite unitary group U(n,q). The asymptotic estimate log(M)=nlog(q)-log(n) +o(log n) is proved.

entry.title: A presentation for the partial dual inverse symmetric monoid
entry.summary: We give a monoid presentation in terms of generators and defining relations for the partial analogue of the finite dual inverse symmetric monoid.

entry.title: The Automorphism Groups of the Groups of Order 8p^2
entry.summary: The automorphism groups for the groups of orders $8p$ and $8p^2$ are given. The calculations were done using the programming language CAYLEY. Explicit presentations for both the groups of these orders and their automorphism groups are given.

entry.title: Aperiodic colorings and tilings of Coxeter groups
entry.summary: We construct a limit aperiodic coloring of hyperbolic groups. Also we construct limit strongly aperiodic strictly balanced tilings of the Davis complex for all Coxeter groups.

entry.title: Le groupe de Cremona est hopfien
entry.summary: We describe the endomorphisms of the Cremona group and obtain that the Cremona group is hopfian.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Comptes Rendus de l'Acad\'{e}mie des Sciences 344 (2007) 153--156

entry.title: Virtual Betti Numbers of Compact Locally Symmetric Spaces
entry.summary: We show that the virtual i-th Betti number of acompact locally symmetric space is either the i-th Betti number of the compact dual or else is infinite.

entry.title: Finiteness and the falsification by fellow traveler property
entry.summary: We prove that groups enjoying the falsification by fellow traveler property are of type $F_3$, and have at most an exponential second order isoperimetric function.
entry.arxiv:comment: Appeared in 2002. I am putting all my past publications on arxiv

entry.title: The loop shortening property and almost convexity
entry.summary: We introduce the "loop shortening property" and the "basepoint loop shortening property" for finitely generated groups, and examine their relation to quadratic isoperimetric functions and almost convexity.
entry.arxiv:comment: Appeared in 2003. I am putting all my past papers on arvix

entry.title: A Profinite Approach to Stable Pairs
entry.summary: We give a short proof, using profinite techniques, that idempotent pointlikes, stable pairs and triples are decidable for the pseudovariety of aperiodic monoids. Stable pairs are also described for the pseudovariety of all finite monoids.

entry.title: Orbit inequivalent actions for groups containing a copy of $\Bbb F_2$
entry.summary: We prove that if a countable group $\Gamma$ contains a copy of $\Bbb F_2$, then it admits uncountably many non orbit equivalent actions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages; the introduction and Section 4 have been rewritten

entry.title: The smallest Moufang loop revisited
entry.summary: We derive presentations for Moufang loops of type $M(G,2)$, defined by Chein, with $G$ finite, two-generated. We then use $G=S_3$ to visualize the smallest non-associative Moufang loop.

entry.title: Realising fusion systems
entry.summary: We show that every fusion system on a p-group S is equal to the fusion system associated to a discrete group G with the property that every p-subgroup of G is conjugate to a subgroup of S.

entry.title: On solvable minimally transitive permutation groups
entry.summary: We investigate properties of finite transitive permutation groups $(G, \Omega)$ in which all proper subgroups of $G$ act intransitively on $\Omega.$ In particular, we are interested in reduction theorems for minimally transitive representations of solvable groups.

entry.title: A short proof that positive generation implies the Hanna Neumann Conjecture
entry.summary: We give a very short proof that a subgroup of a free group that is positively generated cannot be part of a counterexample to the Generalized Hanna Neumann Conjecture.

entry.title: Centralisateurs dans un groupe cristallographique 2-dimensionnel
entry.summary: Nous explicitons les centralisateurs dans un sous-groupe discret cocompact d'isometrie du plan euclidien ----- We make explicit the centralizers of a discrete cocompact subgroup of isometries of the Euclidean plane.

entry.title: Automatic structures for semigroup constructions
entry.summary: We survey results concerning automatic structures for semigroup constructions, providing references and describing the corresponding automatic structures. The constructions we consider are: free products, direct products, Rees matrix semigroups, Bruck-Reilly extensions and wreath products.

entry.title: The local stationary presentation of the alternating groups and normal form
entry.summary: We give the canonical normal form for the elements of the finite or infinite alternating groups using local stationary presentation of these groups.

entry.title: On stable norm in word hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: This work is concerned with the stable norm in word hyperbolic groups as defined by Gromov. We give a short elementary proof of one of its basic property, that is existence of a computable uniform non null lower bound for stable norm in a word hyperbolic group.

entry.title: Finite extension of group with infinite conjugacy classes
entry.summary: We characterize the group property of being with infinite conjugacy classes (or icc, i.e. \not= 1 and of which all conjugacy classes except 1 are infinite) for finite extensions of group.

entry.title: On finite presentability of group F/[M,N]
entry.summary: The characterization of normal subgroups M, N of free group F for which the quotient group F/[M,N] is finitely presented is given.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Vestnik of Moscow University, Ser.1, Mathematics, Mechanics, 2006 N6 p. 19-21

entry.title: Maximal subgroups of almost simple groups with socle $\PSL(2,q)$
entry.summary: We determine all maximal subgroups of the almost simple groups with socle $T=\PSL(2,q)$, that is, of all groups $G$ such that $\PSL(2,q)\leqslant G\leqslant\PGammaL(2,q)$, with $q\geq 4$.

entry.title: Split extensions of group with infinite conjugacy classes
entry.summary: We characterize the group property of being with infinite conjugacy classes (or icc, i.e. in which all conjugacy classes beside 1 are infinite) for split extensions of groups.

entry.title: On extensions of group with infinite conjugacy classes, I
entry.summary: We characterize the group property of being with infinite conjugacy classes (or icc, in which all conjugacy classes beside 1 are infinite) for extensions of some specific groups ; namely extensions of abelian, centerless, icc, or word hyperbolic groups.

entry.title: A group with deep pockets for all finite generating sets
entry.summary: We show that the discrete Heisenberg group has unbounded dead-end depth with respect to every finite generating set. We also show that, in contrast, it has bounded retreat depth.

entry.title: Finite Just Non-Dedekind Groups
entry.summary: A group is just non-Dedekind (JND) if it is not a Dedekind group but all of whose proper homomorphic images are Dedekind groups. The aim of the paper is to classify finite JND-groups.

entry.title: Isometries of CAT(0) cube complexes are semi-simple
entry.summary: We show that an automorphism of an arbitrary CAT(0) cube complex either has a fixed point or preserves some combinatorial axis. It follows that when a group contains a distorted cyclic subgroup, it admits no proper action on a discrete space with walls.

entry.title: Linear automorphism groups of relatively free groups
entry.summary: Let G be a free group in a variety of groups, but G is not absolutely free. We prove that the group of automorphisms Aut(G) is linear iff G is a virtually nilpotent group.

entry.title: Energy of harmonic functions and Gromov's proof of Stallings' theorem
entry.summary: We provide the details for Gromov's proof of Stallings' theorem on groups with infinitely many ends using harmonic functions. The main technical result of the paper is a compactness theorem for a certain family of harmonic functions.

entry.title: Cryptanalysis of shifted conjugacy authentication protocol
entry.summary: In this paper we present the first practical attack on the shifted conjugacy-based authentication protocol proposed by P. Dehornoy. We discuss the weaknesses of that primitive and propose ways to improve the protocol.

entry.title: Reduce Problems From Braid Groups To Braid Monoids
entry.summary: This paper proposes for every $n$, linear time reductions of the word and conjugacy problems on the braid groups $B_n$ to the corresponding problems on the braid monoids $B_n^+$ and moreover only using positive words representations.

entry.title: Higman's PORC conjecture for a family of groups
entry.summary: We prove that the number of groups of order $p^n$ whose Frattini subgroup is central is for fixed $n$ a PORC (`polynomial on residue classes') function of $p$. This extends a result of G. Higman.

entry.title: Limits of dihedral groups
entry.summary: We give a characterization of limits of dihedral groups in the space of finitely generated marked groups. We also describe the topological closure of dihedral groups in the space of marked groups on a fixed number of generators.

entry.title: Groups with the Minimal Conditions for Subgroups and for Nonabelian Subgroups
entry.summary: For some very wide classes $\mathfrak{D}$ and $\mathfrak{B}\subset\mathfrak{D}$ of groups, the author proves that an arbitrary (nonabelian) group $G\in \mathfrak{D}$ (respectively $G\in \mathfrak{B}$) satisfies the minimal condition for (nonabelian) subgroups iff it is Chernikov

entry.title: Geodesics in trees of hyperbolic and relatively hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We present a careful approximation of the geodesics in trees of hyperbolic or relatively hyperbolic groups. As an application we prove a combination theorem for finite graphs of relatively hyperbolic groups, with both Farb's and Gromov's definitions.

entry.title: Automorphisms of Chevalley groups of types B_2 and G_2 over local rings
entry.summary: In the paper we prove that every automorphism of any adjoint Chevalley group of types B_2 or G_2 is standard, i.e., it is a composition of the ``inner'' automorphism, ring automorphism and central automorphism.

entry.title: Quasiisometries between negatively curved Hadamard manifolds
entry.summary: Let X, Y be the universal covers of two compact Riemannian manifolds (with dimension not equal to 4) with negative sectional curvature. Then every quasiisometry between them lies at a finite distance from a bilipschitz homeomorphism.

entry.title: A note on groups with the minimal conditions for nonabelian and abelian subgroups
entry.summary: We give a new proof of the known Shunkov's Theorem on locally finite groups with the minimal condition for nonabelian subgroups and also an extension of the known Suchkova-Shunkov Theorem on Shunkov groups with the minimal condition for abelian subgroups.

entry.title: Ideal boundary of 7-systolic complexes and groups
entry.summary: We prove that ideal boundary of a 7-systolic group is strongly hereditarily aspherical. For some class of 7-systolic groups we show their boundaries are connected and without local cut points, thus getting some results concerning splittings of those groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages. Algebr. Geom. Topol., to appear

entry.title: Sur le centralisateur d'une involution de 2E6(2)
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that $2^{20+1}.U_6(2)$, known as the centralizer of an involution in the group $2E_6(2)$ is a quotient of a Coxeter group. We obtain a presentation of $2^{20+1}.U_6(2)$ as a $Q_{222}$-group, which now resolve a long pending question.

entry.title: The Baum-Connes conjecture for countable subgroups of SL(2)
entry.summary: We present an alternative approach to the result of Guentner, Higson, and Weinberger concerning the Baum-Connes conjecture for finitely generated subgroups of SL(2,C). Using finite-dimensional methods, we show that the Baum-Connes assembly map for such groups is an isomorphism.

entry.title: Virtually free pro-p groups whose torsion elements have finite centralizer
entry.summary: A finitely generated virtually free pro-p group with finite centralizers of its torsion elements is the free pro-p product of finite p-groups and a free pro-p factor.

entry.title: Structure of normal twisted group rings
entry.summary: In this paper we describe those groups G and commutative rings K for which the twisted group rings K*G are f-normal.

entry.title: SL(n,Z[t]) is not FP_{n-1}
entry.summary: We prove the result from the title using the geometry of Euclidean buildings.

entry.title: Cosets, genericity, and the Weyl group
entry.summary: We prove a non-generosity theorem for proper cosets in groups of finite Morley rank and elaborate on the theory of Weyl groups in this context.

entry.title: Induced quasi-actions: a remark
entry.summary: In this note we observe that the notion of an induced representation has an analog for quasi-actions. We then use induced quasi-actions to refine some earlier rigidity results for product spaces.

entry.title: Carter subgroups of finite groups
entry.summary: In the paper it is proven that Carter subgroups of a finite group are conjugate. A complete classification of Carter subgroups in finite almost simple groups is also obtained.

entry.title: Arithmetic Groups Have Rational Representation Growth
entry.summary: Let G be an arithmetic lattice in a semisimple algebraic group over a number field. We show that if G has the congruence subgroup property, then the number of n-dimensional irreducible representations of G grows like n^a, where a is a rational number.

entry.title: The Minimal Degree for a Class of Finite Complex Reflection Groups
entry.summary: We calculate the minimal degree for a class of finite complex reflection groups $G(p,p,q)$, for $p$ and $q$ primes and establish relationships between minimal degrees when these groups are taken in a direct product.

entry.title: Finitary Group Cohomology and Group Actions on Spheres
entry.summary: We show that if G is an infinitely generated locally (polycyclic-by-finite) group with cohomology almost everywhere finitary, then every finite subgroup of G acts freely and orthogonally on some sphere.

entry.title: Characters of prime degree
entry.summary: Let $G$ be a finite nilpotent group, $\chi$ and $\psi$ be irreducible complex characters of $G$ of prime degree. Assume that $\chi(1)=p$. Then either the product $\chi\psi$ is a multiple of an irreducible character or $\chi\psi$ is the linear combination of at least $\frac{p+1}{2}$ distinct irreducible characters.

entry.title: Notes on uniform exponential growth and Tits alternative
entry.summary: These notes contain results concerning uniform exponential growth which were obtained in collaborations with E. Breuillard and A. Salehi-Golsefidy, mostly during 2005, improving Eskin-Mozes-Oh theorem \cite{EMO}, as well as a uniform uniform version of Tits alternative improving \cite{uti}.

entry.title: On countably compact 0-simple topological inverse semigroups
entry.summary: We describe the structure of 0-simple countably compact topological inverse semigroups and the structure of congruence-free countably compact topological inverse semigroups.

entry.title: Note on the Cantor-Bendixson rank of limit groups
entry.summary: We show that the Cantor-Bendixson rank of a limit group is finite as well as that of a limit group of a linear group.

entry.title: Unitary Braid Representations with Finite Image
entry.summary: We characterize unitary representations of braid groups $B_n$ of degree linear in $n$ and finite images of such representations of degree exponential in $n$.

entry.title: Groebner-Shirshov basis for the braid semigroup
entry.summary: We found Groebner-Shirshov basis for the braid semigroup $B^+_{n+1}$. It gives a new algorithm for the solution of the word problem for the braid semigroup and so for the braid group.

entry.title: Markov and Artin normal form theorem for braid groups
entry.summary: In this paper we will present the results of Artin--Markov on braid groups by using the Groebner--Shirshov basis. As a consequence we can reobtain the normal form of Artin--Markov--Ivanovsky as an easy corollary.

entry.title: Compactly supported cohomology of buildings
entry.summary: We compute the compactly supported cohomology of the standard realization of any locally finite building.

entry.title: Survey on the Burnside ring of compact Lie groups
entry.summary: The definition and basic properties of the Burnside ring of compact Lie groups are presented, with emphasis on the analogy with the construction of the Burnside ring of finite groups.

entry.title: Automata generating free products of groups of order 2
entry.summary: We construct a family of automata with n states, n>3, acting on a rooted binary tree that generate the free products of cyclic groups of order 2.

entry.title: When are dual Cayley automaton semigroups finite?
entry.summary: In this note we prove that, for a finite semigroup $S$, the dual Cayley automaton semigroup $\mathbf{C^{\ast}}(S)$ is finite if and only if $S$ is $\mathcal{H}$-trivial and has no non-trivial right zero subsemigroups.

entry.title: A family of non-isomorphism results
entry.summary: We give a short argument showing that if $m, n \in {1, 2, ...} \cup {\omega}$, then the groups mV and nV are not isomorphic. This answers a question of Brin.

entry.title: Homology and finiteness properties of SL_2(Z[t,t^{-1}])
entry.summary: We show that the group $H_2(\slzti;\zz)$ is not finitely generated, answering a question mentioned by Bux and Wortman in \cite{bux}.

entry.title: Strongly t-logarithmic t-generating sets: Geometric properties of some soluble groups
entry.summary: We introduce the concept of a strongly t-logarithmic t-generating set for a Z[t,t^{-1}]-module, which enables us to prove that a large class of soluble groups are not almost convex. We also prove some results about dead-end depth.

entry.title: Krull dimension of solvable groups
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that free solvable groups have finite Krull dimension. In fact, this is true for much wider class of solvable groups, termed rigid groups. Along the way we study the algebraic structure of the limit solvable groups (fully residually free solvable groups).

entry.title: A note on cyclic semiregular subgroups of some 2-transitive permutation groups
entry.summary: We determine the semi-regular subgroups of the 2-transitive permutation groups PGL(2,n), PSL(2,n), PGU(3,n), PSU(3,n), Sz(n) and Ree(n) with n a suitable power of a prime number p.

entry.title: Arithmetic aspects of self-similar groups
entry.summary: We prove that an irreducible lattice in a semisimple algebraic group is virtually isomorphic to an arithmetic lattice if and only if it admits a faithful self-similar action on a rooted tree of finite valency.

entry.title: Small groups of finite Morley rank with involutions
entry.summary: We consider groups of finite Morley rank with solvable local subgroups of even and mixed types. We also consider miscellaneous aspects of small groups of finite Morley rank of odd type.

entry.title: Strongly closed subgroups of finite groups
entry.summary: This paper gives a complete classification of the finite groups that contain a strongly closed p-subgroup for p any prime.

entry.title: Group actions on median spaces
entry.summary: We investigate the geometry of median metric spaces. The group-theoretic applications are towards Kazhdan's property (T) and Haagerup's property.
entry.arxiv:comment: 21 pages. Revision of work submitted as a Master's thesis at McGill University in 2004. Comments are welcome

entry.title: Extensions of profinite duality groups
entry.summary: We show that the class of profinite duality groups is closed under group extensions provided that the kernel satisfies some finiteness condition. This extends earlier results of Pletch and of Wingberg.

entry.title: Counting the Closed Subgroups of Profinite Groups
entry.summary: The sets of closed and closed-normal subgroups of a profinite group carry a natural profinite topology. Through a combination of algebraic and topological methods the size of these subgroup spaces is calculated, and the spaces partially classified up to homeomorphism.

entry.title: Classifying Spaces of Subgroups of Profinite Groups
entry.summary: The set of all closed subgroups of a profinite carries a natural profinite topology. This space of subgroups can be classified up to homeomorphism in many cases, and tight bounds placed on its complexity as expressed by its scattered height.

entry.title: Unsolvability of the isomorphism problem for [free abelian]-by-free groups
entry.summary: The isomorphism problem for [free abelian]-by-free groups is unsolvable.
entry.arxiv:comment: added reference to a paper by Bruno Zimmermann containing a similar result for (free abelian)-by-surface groups

entry.title: Extended Wreath Products
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, since proposed extensions are equivalent at any k to either wreath or direct product.

entry.title: A 3-local characterization of M_12 and SL_3(3)
entry.summary: We identify the sporadic simple group $\mathrm{M}_{12}$ and the simple group $\mathrm{SL}_3(3)$ from some part of their 3-local structure and give a graph theoretic analogue of the resulting theorem.

entry.title: On the linearity of HNN-extensions with abelian base group
entry.summary: We show that an HNN-extension with finitely generated abelian base group is Z-linear if and only if it is residually finite.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proof of proposition 2.1 clarified, typos corrected

entry.title: The Spherical Maximal Function on the Free Two-step Nilpotent Lie Group
entry.summary: We consider here the free two step nilpotent Lie group, provided with the homogeneous Kor\'anyi norm; we prove the $L^p$-boundedness of the maximal function corresponding to the homogeneous unit sphere, for some $p$.

entry.title: A Combinatorial Property of Ideals in Free Profinite Monoids
entry.summary: We prove every regular element of a free profinite monoid generates a prime ideal; in particular the minimal ideal is prime. The latter result was first proved by Almeida and Volkov using techniques from symbolic dynamics; our proof is elementary.

entry.title: The Figure Eight Knot Group is Conjugacy Separable
entry.summary: We prove that torsion free subgroups of PGL(2,C) (abstractly) commensurable with the Euclidean Bianchi groups are conjugacy separable. As a consequence we deduce the result stated in the title.

entry.title: Periodic elements of the free idempotent generated semigroup on a biordered set
entry.summary: We show that every periodic element of the free idempotent generated semigroup on an arbitrary biordered set belongs to a subgroup of the semigroup.

entry.title: Yet another solution to the Burnside problem for matrix semigroups
entry.summary: We use the kernel category to give a finiteness condition for semigroups. As a consequence we provide yet another proof that finitely generated periodic semigroups of matrices are finite.

entry.title: A classification of spherical conjugacy classes in good characteristic
entry.summary: We classify spherical conjugacy classes in a simple algebraic group over an algebraically closed field of good, odd characteristic.
entry.arxiv:comment: An argument in a case in type F4 is rectified

entry.title: Compressed word problems in HNN-extensions and amalgamated products
entry.summary: It is shown that the compressed word problem for an HNN-extension with base group H and finite associated subgroups is polynomial time Turing-reducible to the compressed word problem for H. An analogous result for amalgamated free products is shown as well.

entry.title: Strongly p-embedded subgroups
entry.summary: We study finite groups which possess a strongly p-embedded subgroup for some odd prime p. The main results of the paper will be applied in the ongoing project to classify the simple groups of local characteristic p.

entry.title: Symmetric generation of Coxeter groups
entry.summary: We provide involutory symmetric generating sets of finitely generated Coxeter groups, fulfilling a suitable finiteness condition, which in particular is fulfilled in the finite, affine and compact hyperbolic cases.

entry.title: The class S as an ME invariant
entry.summary: We prove that being in Ozawa's class $\mathcal{S}$ is a measure equivalence invariant.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Int. Math. Res. Not., 2009, article ID rnp025

entry.title: On strongly $p$-embedded subgroups of Lie rank 2
entry.summary: Suppose that $p$ is a prime, $G$ is a finite group and $H$ is a strongly $p$-embedded subgroup in $G$. We consider the possibility that $F^*(H)$ is a simple group of Lie rank 2 defined in characteristic $p$.

entry.title: Automorphisms of classical geometries in the sense of Klein
entry.summary: In this note, we compute the group of automorphisms of Projective, Affine and Euclidean Geometries in the sense of Klein. As an application, we give a simple construction of the outer automorphism of S_6.

entry.title: On surface subgroups of doubles of free groups
entry.summary: We give several sufficient conditions for a double of a free group along a cyclic subgroup to contain a surface subgroup.

entry.title: On prolongations of quasigroups
entry.summary: We prove that any quasigroup admissing complete or quasicomplete mapping has a prolongation to a quasigroup having one element more.

entry.title: A new metric criterion for non-amenability I
entry.summary: By studying the so-called traveling salesman groups, we obtain a new metric criterion for non-amenability. As an application, we give a new and very short proof of non-amenability of free Burnside groups with sufficiently big odd exponent.

entry.title: Bisets as categories, and tensor product of induced bimodules
entry.summary: Bisets can be considered as categories. This note uses this point of view to give a simple proof of a Mackey-like formula expressing the tensor product of two induced bimodules.

entry.title: On generalized inverses and Green's relations
entry.summary: We study generalized inverses on semigroups by means of Green's relations. We first define the notion of inverse along an element and study its properties. Then we show that the classical generalized inverses (group inverse, Drazin inverse and Moore-Penrose inverse) belong to this class.

entry.title: Groups Elementarily Equivalent to a Free 2-nilpotent Group of Finite Rank
entry.summary: In this paper we find a characterization for groups elementarily equivalent to a free nilpotent group $G$ of class 2 and arbitrary finite rank.

entry.title: Centralisers of Finite Subgroups in Soluble Groups of Type FP_n
entry.summary: We show that for soluble groups of type FPn, centralisers of finite subgroups need not be of type FPn.

entry.title: Self-similarity and random walks
entry.summary: This is an introductory level survey of some topics from a new branch of fractal analysis -- the theory of self-similar groups. We discuss recent works on random walks on self-similar groups and their applications to the problem of amenability for these groups.

entry.title: A solvable group isospectral to S(4,3)
entry.summary: We construct a solvable group G of order 5648590729620 such that the set of element orders of G coincides with that of the simple group S(4,3). This completes the determination of finite simple groups isospectral to solvable groups.

entry.title: On Frattini arguments in L-groups of finite Morley rank
entry.summary: We modify the Frecon-Jaligot construction of Carter subgroups to show that a degenerate type group has a Carter subgroup invariant under the Sylow 2-subgroup of a group of automorphisms; thus reducing the need to know that Carter subgroups are conjugate in degenerate type groups.

entry.title: Weyl groups of small groups of finite Morley rank
entry.summary: We examine Weyl groups of minimal connected simple groups of finite Morley rank of degenerate type. We show that they are cyclic, and lift isomorphically to subgroups of the ambient group.

entry.title: Minimal odd order automorphism groups
entry.summary: We show that 3^7 is the smallest order of a non-trivial odd order group which occurs as the full automorphism group of a finite group.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, no figures. Manuscript accepted for publication

entry.title: On Kostant's partial order on hyperbolic elements
entry.summary: We study Kostant's partial order on the elements of a semisimple Lie group in relations with the finite dimensional representations. In particular, we prove the converse statement of [3, Theorem 6.1] on hyperbolic elements.

entry.title: On a Quasi-Phan Theorem for Orthogonal Groups
entry.summary: This paper constructs a presentation for the orthogonal groups. The amalgam is contained in that constructed by Ralf Gramlich Hendrik Van Maldeghem and arXiv:0708.1583 but it's shorter.

entry.title: A criterion for HNN extensions of finite $p$-groups to be residually $p$
entry.summary: We give a criterion for an HNN extension of a finite $p$-group to be residually $p$.

entry.title: A newcomer's guide to zeta functions of groups and rings
entry.summary: These notes grew out of lectures given at the LMS-EPSRC Short Course on Asymptotic Methods in Infinite Group Theory, University of Oxford, 9-14 September 2007, organised by Dan Segal.

entry.title: Products of conjugacy classes of the alternating group
entry.summary: Let A_n be the alternating group on n letters. For n>5, we describe the elements alpha, beta in A_n when alpha^{A_n} beta^{A_n} is the union of at most four distinct conjugacy classes.

entry.title: A sofic group away from amenable groups
entry.summary: We give an example of a sofic group, which is not a limit of amenable groups.

entry.title: On Subgroups of Tetrahedron Groups
entry.summary: We present a framework to determine subgroups of tetrahedron groups and tetrahedron Kleinian groups, based on tools in color symmetry theory.

author.name: Ma. Louise N. De Las Penas

entry.title: On a characterization of locally finite groups in terms of linear cellular automata
entry.summary: We prove that a group $G$ is locally finite if and only if every surjective real (or complex) linear cellular automaton with finite-dimensional alphabet over $G$ is injective.

entry.title: Multiplicative structure of 2x2 tropical matrices
entry.summary: We study the algebraic structure of the semigroup of all $2 \times 2$ tropical matrices under multiplication. Using ideas from tropical geometry, we give a complete description of Green's relations and the idempotents and maximal subgroups of this semigroup.

entry.title: Submonoids and rational subsets of groups with infinitely many ends
entry.summary: In this paper we show that the membership problems for finitely generated submonoids and for rational subsets are recursively equivalent for groups with two or more ends.

entry.title: Lamplighter graphs do not admit harmonic functions of finite energy
entry.summary: We prove that a lamplighter graph of a locally finite graph over a finite graph does not admit a non-constant harmonic function of finite Dirichlet energy.

entry.title: Equivariant, locally finite inverse representations with uniformly bounded zipping length, for arbitrary finitely presented groups
entry.summary: This is the first of a three parts paper providing full details for our previous announcement in Pr\'epublications Orsay 2007-16, arXiv:0711.3579. Here we prove the results stated in the title.

entry.title: Asphericity and small cancellation theory for rotation family of groups
entry.summary: Using small cancellation for rotating families of groups, we construct new examples of aspherical polyhedra.
entry.arxiv:comment: 35 pages, to appear in "Groups, Geometry, and Dynamics"

entry.title: Pairs of valuations and the geometry of soluble groups
entry.summary: We introduce the concepts of a pair of valuations and a good generating set and show how they can be used to prove geometric properties of soluble groups.

entry.title: Automorphisms of Chevalley groups of type $F_4$ over local rings with 1/2
entry.summary: In the paper we prove that every automorphism of a Chevalley group of type $F_4$ over a commutative local ring with~1/2 is standard, i. e., it is a composition of ring and inner automorphisms.

entry.title: Commuting graphs of odd prime order elements in simple groups
entry.summary: We study the commuting graph on elements of odd prime order in finite simple groups. The results are used in a forthcoming paper describing the structure of Bruck loops and Bol loops of exponent 2.

entry.title: On Bruck Loops of 2-power Exponent, II
entry.summary: As announced in [arXiv:0908.2596], we show that the non-passive finite simple groups are among the $PSL_2(q)$ with $q-1 \ge 4$ a 2-power. [arXiv:0908.2596]: Baumeister,Stein,Stroth: On Bruck Loops of 2-power Exponent

entry.title: Automorphisms of the graph of free splittings
entry.summary: We prove that every simplicial automorphism of the free splitting graph of a free group of at least rank 3 is induced by an outer automorphism of the free group.
